1.name: The Amulet of Lost Voices
1.image: Amulet of Lost Voices Icon.png
1.icon: Amulet of Lost Voices Unfaded Icon.png
1.description: The Amulet of Lost Voices is a rare Amulet that allows the wearer to cast Speak with Dead once per Long Rest.
1.quote: The dead hold no secrets from Jergal's Scriveners of Doom.

effects.name: Speak with Dead|w=40
effects.description: Can cast at Level 1 once per Long Rest.

1.name: The Blast Pendant
1.image: The Blast Pendant Icon.png
1.icon: The Blast Pendant Unfaded Icon.png
1.description: The Blast Pendant is an uncommon Amulet that allows the wearer to focus and discharge their Lightning Charges to strengthen their next lightning spell.
1.quote: Though they only worked together for a short time, it is hard to overstate the influence Lenore the cleric of Mystra had on Yrre the Sparkstruck, who often likened harnessing lightning to manipulating the Weave.

effects.name: Lightning Blast|w=40
effects.description: Once per Long Rest you may focus the electricity in your veins as a bonus action. Your next lightning spell or cantrip deals additional Lightning|Lightning damage equal to your remaining Lightning Charges. On a hit, all of your Lightning Charges are consumed.

1.name: The Ever-Seeing Eye
1.image: The Ever-Seeing Eye Icon.png
1.icon: The Ever-Seeing Eye Unfaded Icon.png
1.description: The Ever-Seeing Eye is an uncommon Amulet that allows the wearer to cast Protection from Evil and Good once per Short Rest.
1.quote: A pale, green eye, pierced by the twisting branches of a dead tree - the result of a foolhardy woman begging Auntie for a favour.

effects.name: Protection from Evil and Good|w=40
effects.description: Can the spell at Level 1, once per Short Rest.

1.name: The Spectator Eyes
1.image: Amulet Necklace A Bronze A 1 Faded.png
1.icon: Amulet Necklace A Bronze A 1 Unfaded Icon.png
1.description: The Spectator Eyes is a very rare Amulet that allows the wearer to cast Ray of Fear and Wounding Ray once per Long Rest.
1.quote: Spectators are hideous aberrations that float above the ground, fiercely staring around and shooting beams at anything they don't appreciate.

effects.name: Ray of Fear|w=40
effects.description: Can cast at Level 3, once per Long Rest.

effects.name: Wounding Ray|w=40
effects.description: Can cast at Level 3, once per Long Rest.

1.name: Tressym Collar
1.image: Amulet Necklace A Bronze A 1 Faded.png
1.icon: Amulet Necklace A Bronze A 1 Unfaded Icon.png
1.description: Tressym Collar is a very rare Amulet that allows the wearer to cast Telekinesis once per Long Rest.
1.quote: The gem in this collar's centre is placed as a common courtesy: It allows the tressym's summoner to be identified and complained to in the case of bereaved pet woners or pidgeon-masters. This one glows with a Waterdhaven name: Gale Dekarios.

effects.name: Telekinesis|w=40
effects.description: Cast as a level 5 spell (Long Rest).

1.name: Uncovered Mysteries
1.image: Amulet Necklace B Silver A 1 Faded.png
1.icon: Amulet Necklace B Silver A 1 Unfaded Icon.png
1.description: Uncovered Mysteries is a rare Amulet that allows the wearer to cast Detect Thoughts once per Long Rest.
1.quote: Beneath the layers of dust covering this necklace, its inlaid gems still give off a blue sparkle - the colour of Mystra's clergy.

effects.name: Detect Thoughts|w=40
effects.description: Can cast at Level 1, once per Long Rest.

1.name: Unflinching Protector Amulet
1.image: Keepsake Locket A Faded.png
1.icon: Keepsake Locket A Unfaded Icon.png
1.description: Unflinching Protector Amulet is a very rare Amulet that can be obtained from Ptaris.
1.quote: Touching this amulet's centerpiece, you are imbued with a vision of woven strands, and the strands coming apart and holding true and firm over your friends, like shields banded in a haze of golden light.

effects.name: Unflinching Protection
effects.description: When a nearby ally is targeted by an attack of any kind, you can use your Reaction to make that attack automatically miss. This effect can only be used once per Short Rest.

2.name: Acrobat Shoes
2.description: Acrobat Shoes is a pair of rare Boots that grants a bonus to Acrobatics and Advantage on Dexterity Saving Throws.
2.quote: These flexible shoes were once owned by Audreyne Willoughs, who, in a somewhat ironic twist if fate, ran away from the circus to join her parents back home.

2.description: Blackguard's Greaves are a rare pair of Greaves that grant their wearer a permanent Longstrider effect and a +1 bonus to Athletics.
2.quote: Clad on the desiccated feet of a death knight, these boots have walked a long and terrible path. They strode through the tattered remains of their owner's oath. With every heavy footstep, they have sounded pure fear into the hearts of men.

effects.name: Strider Movement
effects.description: You gain Longstrider.

2.name: Bonespike Boots
2.description: Bonespike Boots are a Very rare pair of Boots that give the character access to the Brutal Leap ability.
2.quote: Armour designed for the aerodynamic leaping and striking and general screaming of your standard barbarian.

effects.name: Evasive Instinct
effects.description: You have a +1 bonus to ArmourClass and Saving Throws as long as you are not wearing shield.

effects.name: Refined Vaulting
effects.description: Jump (Bonus Action)|Jump distance is increased by 1.5m / 5ft.

effects.name: Brutal Leap|w=40
effects.description: Leap at a target and possibly knock it Prone.

2.name: Boots of Aid and Comfort
2.image: Boots of Aid and Comfort Icon.png
2.icon: Boots of Aid and Comfort Unfaded Icon.png
2.description: Boots of Aid and Comfort are an uncommon pair of Temporary Hit Points to creatures healed by the wearer.
2.quote: Sturdy and well-worn, these boots make a snug fit on any wearer.

effects.name: The Comeback
effects.description: When the wearer heals a target, it gains an additional 3 Temporary Hit Points.

2.name: Boots of Apparent Death
2.description: Boots of Apparent Death are a rare set of Boots that grants the wearer the ability to cast Feign Death once per Short Rest.
2.quote: Practical jokes with these boots often involve all your stuff being stolen by opportunistic cousins.

effects.name: Feign Death|w=40
effects.description: Can cast at Level 3 (Short Rest).

2.name: Boots of Arcane Bolstering
2.icon: Boots of Arcane Bolstering Unfaded Icon.png
2.description: Boots of Arcane Bolstering is a pair of rare Boots that grants Arcane Charge each time the wearer Dashes, adding +1 bonus to damage with spells while Threatened.
2.quote: Fizzling barbs of enchantment magic crackle from the laces of these boots.

effects.name: Rapid Caster
effects.description: Each time they Dash, the wearer gains Arcane Charge for 2.

2.name: Boots of Brilliance
2.description: The Boots of Brilliance are a rare pair of Boots that allow the wearer to replenish one Bardic Inspiration charge once per long rest.
2.quote: Tiny bells are sewn into the boots' cuffs. They jingle subtly with every step.

effects.name: Restore Bardic Inspiration
effects.description: Once per Long Rest you can use your Action to play your instrument and restore one of your Bardic Inspiration charges.

2.name: Boots of Elemental Momentum
2.icon: Boots of Elemental Momentum Unfaded Icon.png
2.description: The Boots of Elemental Momentum are an uncommon pair of Boots that grant Momentum whenever the wearer deals elemental damage with a spell or cantrip.
2.quote: Toughened metal boots, highly insulated with heavy leather and padding for use in any and all elements.

effects.name: Elemental Momentum
effects.description: Whenever the wearer deals Acid, Cold, Fire, Lightning or Thunder damage with Spells or Cantrip, they gain Momentum for 2.

2.name: Boots of Genial Striding
2.icon: Boots of Genial Striding Unfaded Icon.png
2.description: The Boots of Genial Striding is a pair of rare Boots that allow the wearer to move over difficult terrain without impediment.
2.quote: The soles of these boots warp and shift like warm clay manipulared by an unseen sculptor's hands.

effects.name: Genial Strider
effects.description: The wearer's Movement Speed is unimpeded by Difficult Terrain

2.name: Boots of Persistence
2.description: Boots of Persistence is a pair of Boots that grant their wearer permanent Freedom of Movement and Longstrider effects.
2.quote: 'If I had a copper for all the adventurin folk I seen gutted or cut up, or clawed like they was made of wet paper, just cause they couldn't move quick enough when speed might have saved em... well, I'd be suckin good brandy from crystal rather than this fuckin swill.' - Overheard in a tavern in Baldur's Gate.

effects.name: Legendary Mobility
effects.description: You gain Freedom of Movement and Longstrider.

2.icon: Boots Metal Githyanki B Magic Unfaded Icon.png
2.description: Boots of Psionic Movement are a very rare pair of Boots that allow Githyanki wearers to fly, and enhances their attacks with Psychic|Psychic damage.
2.quote: When not atop their dragons, gith are not particularly air-worthy. This is probably for the best. The imposition of downward gravity tends to put most people in a mood.

effects.description: When a githyanki casts Fly, their next melee weapon attack deals an additional 1d4|Psychic damage.

2.quote: Featherlaced and flexible of sole, these boots have been used to round up - and outrun - many a foe.

2.name: Boots of Stormy Clamour
2.icon: Boots of Stormy Clamour Unfaded Icon.png

2.quote: Pearls of thunder rumble at the back of your skull with every step taken in these boots.

effects.description: When the wearer inflicts a condition upon a hostile creature, they also inflict 2 turns of Reverberation.

2.description: The Boots of Striding are an uncommon pair of Boots that grants the wearer a burst of speed whenever they begin concentrating on a spell.

2.name: Boots of Uninhibited Kushigo
2.icon: Boots of Uninhibited Kushigo Unfaded Icon.png
2.description: The Boots of Uninhibited Kushigo are a rare pair of Boots that add your Wisdom modifier to your unarmed strikes' damage.
2.quote: During a hilltop battle that soaked the slopes in gore, Kushigo's best friend Irishi was scalped before he could help her.  The enemy held up the bloody wig, and Kushigo fell upon one, and then another, until he had killed so many that they hung from his antlered shoulders like skewered effigies.

effects.name: Experienced And Deadly
effects.description: The wearer deals additional damage equal to their Wisdom Modifier with Unarmed Strike|unarmed strikes.

2.name: Boots of Very Fast Blinking
2.description: Boots of Very Fast Blinking are an uncommon pair of Boots that grant the wearer the ability to cast Misty Step once per turn, but with the drawback that their clothes are left behind.
2.quote: You can cast Misty Step with the caveat that you will teleport leaving your clothes behind.

effects.name: Misty Step|w=40
effects.description: Can cast once per turn. The caster's clothes are left behind.

2.name: Cinder Shoes
2.description: Cinder Shoes is a pair of uncommon Boots that grants Heat whenever the wearer Burning|Burns an enemy.
2.quote: Despite the many scorch marks, these leather boots are somehow still supple and intact.

effects.name: Cinders
effects.description: Whenever you Burning|Burn an enemy, you gain 2 turns of Heat.

2.name: Dark Justiciar Boots
2.description: The Dark Justiciar Boots are a rare pair of Boots that grants the wearer better Dexteritys and the ability to cast Shadow Teleportation once per Short Rest.
2.quote: Scratched in places, scorched in others, and worn thin at the heel, these boots bear the indelible marks of experience.

2.name: Featherlight Boots

2.quote: The soft and supple leather glides over your skin. Wearing them feels like running barefoot.

effects.name: Burst of Speed
effects.description: When the wearer has 50% Hit Points or less, their Movement Speed is increased by 3m / 10ft.

2.name: Helldusk Boots
2.description: The Helldusk Boots are a very rare pair of Boots that allows the wearer to ignore Difficult Terrain and being forcibly moved by hostile spells or action, to use a reaction to succeed on a SavingThrow, and to use the Hellcrawler bonus action.
2.quote: No ore takes better to being forged than the infernal iron of Avernus, where the archdevil Zariel presides.

effects.name: Steadfast
effects.description: You cannot be forcibly moved by a foe's spells or actions, and you ignore the effects of Difficult Terrain.

effects.name: Infernal Evasion
effects.description: When you fail a SavingThrow, you may use your reaction to succeed instead.

effects.name: Hellcrawler|w=40
effects.description: Teleport to an area and deal 2d8|Fire damage where you land. The impact blast spreads in a 3m / 10ft zone.

2.name: Hoarfrost Boots
2.description: Hoarfrost Boots are an uncommon pair of Boots that allow the wearer to not slip on icy surfaces.
2.quote: A smattering of tiny ice crystals have formed cleats on the soles of these hardy boots.

effects.name: Hoarfrost Balance
effects.description: You cannot fall Prone while traversing icy terrain.

2.name: Linebreaker Boots
2.description: The Linebreaker Boots are a rare pair of Boots that grants the wearer Wrath whenever they Dash.
2.quote: Lightweight fur and leather, designed to speed the wearer's charge into battle.

effects.name: Adrenaline Rush
effects.description: When the wearer Dash|Dashes or takes a similar action during combat, they gain Wrath for 2.

2.name: Mystra's Grace
2.description: Mystra's Grace is an uncommon pair of Boots that allow the wearer to cast the Feather Fall spell at will.

effects.description: Can cast at will at Level 1.

2.name: Slinging Shoes
2.description: Slinging Shoes is a pair of Boots that deal psychic damage and return to the wearer when thrown.
2.quote: These shoes were formerly enchanted to return to their owner's feet. This caused a great deal of trouble for owners, who, while wearing a slipper or a nice heeled number, kept being kicked in the ankles by jealous footwear.

effects.description: Returns to its owner when thrown. On a hit deal an additional 2d4|Psychic damage.

effects.description: Dexterity Saving Throws +1

2.name: Spaceshunt Boots
2.description: Spaceshunt Boots is a rare pair of Boots that allow the wearer to cast the Dimension Door spell as an Action once per Long Rest.
2.quote: These boots are well-maintained and clean, though their soles are thin from wear.

effects.name: Dimension Door|w=40
effects.description: Can cast Dimension Door once per Long Rest.

2.name: Spiderstep Boots
2.description: The Spiderstep Boots are an uncommon pair of Boots that allow the wearer to walk across webs freely.
2.quote: Slightly sticky to the touch, these boots have an excellent grip.

effects.name: Spider Step
effects.description: Immune to being Enwebbed. Your Movement Speed is not affected by web surfaces.

2.name: Springstep Boots
2.description: Springstep Boots is a pair of rare Boots that allows the wearer to gain Momentum whenever they dash in combat, further improving their Movement Speed.
2.quote: Supple leather rebounds with every step, as if urging the wearer on.

effects.name: Swift Strides
effects.description: When the wearer Dash|Dashes or takes a similar action during combat, they gain Momentum for 3.

2.name: Swiresy Shoes
2.description: The Swiresy Shoes are a pair of rare Jumping distance and Acrobatics skill.
2.quote: Likely fashioned in tribute to the extremely small, high-vaulting rascal who pillaged many a hen house - Lupperdiddle Swires.

effects.description: Acrobatics +1

2.description: The Speedy Lightfeet are a pair of rare Boots that allow the wearer to gain Lightning Charges when Dashing in combat.
2.quote: It is said The Speedy Lightfeet were the first of many lightning inventions made by Yrre the Sparkstruck. The boots' old, frayed edges zap and crackle with even the slightest movement.

effects.description: When the wearer Dash|Dashes or takes a similar action in combat, they gain 3 Lightning Charges (Per turn).

2.name: The Watersparkers
2.description: The Watersparkers are a pair of rare Boots that allow the wearer to electrify water surfaces and gain Lightning Charges.
2.quote: An enormous storm was raging the first time Yrre the Sparkstruck left the Underdark. The deep gnome's interest in lightning at once became an all-consuming obsession, and they would spend the rest of their years trying to recreate that storm's power themselves.

effects.name: Electrify Water
effects.description: When the wearer stands in water during combat, it becomes electrified.

effects.name: Watersparks
effects.description: If the wearer starts their turn on an electrified surface, they gain 3 Lightning Charges.

2.name: Tyrannical Jackboots
2.description: Tyrannical Jackboots are an uncommon pair of Boots that grant a +1 bonus to Charisma checks and Saving Throws.
2.quote: Each step taken in Gortash's shoes is a reflection of the man himself: quick, sharp, and terrible.

effects.name: Scintillating
effects.description: You gain a +1 bonus to Charisma Ability Checks and Saving Throws.

2.name: Unwanted Masterwork Greaves
2.description: Unwanted Masterwork Greaves are a rare pair of Boots that provide a bonus to Athletics. It is part of the Unwanted set.
2.quote: These boots are stamped with the marks of a cancelled commission. Despite their discarded fate, they still hum with complex infernal arcana.

2.name: Varsh Ko'kuu's Boots
2.description: The Varsh Ko'kuu's Boots are an uncommon pair of Boots that grant immunity to Acid Surfaces and Resistance to Acid|Acid damage.
2.quote: Though the leather is slick with acid, the corrosive liquid doesn't seem to damage the boots - nor does it penetrate.

effects.name: Caretaker's Care
effects.description: Acidic Surfaces don't affect you, and you are Acid|double|nocat=true Resistant to Acid damage.

2.name: Vital Conduit Boots
2.icon: Boots Metal Githyanki Magic Unfaded Icon.png
2.description: The Vital Conduit Boots are a pair of rare Boots that grants the wearer temporary Hit Points when they cast a Spell that requires Concentration.
2.quote: Tenser's notes on arcane displacement were not only read by wizards - other avid readers included entreprising smiths eager to break into the magic items market

effects.name: Vital Conduit
effects.description: Grants the wearer 8 Temporary Hit Points when they cast a Spell that requires Concentration.

3.name: Cindermoth Cloak
3.description: Cindermoth Cloak is an uncommon Cloak that inflicts Burning on any foe within 2m / 7ft that damages the wearer.
3.quote: With every rustle of this cloak, small moths like windblown embers appear around you - they flutter for a moment, then fade into inconsequence.

effects.name: Flaming Shroud
effects.description: A creature that damages the wearer within 2m / 7ft receives Burning.

3.name: Cloak of Cunning Brume
3.icon: Cloak of Cunning Brume Unfaded Icon.png
3.description: Cloak of Cunning Brume is an uncommon Cloak that grants the user a smokescreen cloud effect when trying to Disengage.
3.quote: One of the relics of Deep Durrea's rebellious children. The children found nothing of use in the vault and were discouraged. But in the morning the Vault Keykeeper's son, who admired the children, sought them out - and in his arms he brought a wealth of things, forged in shadow.

effects.name: Cunning Brume
effects.description: When the wearer Disengage|Disengages, they also create a foggy cloud with 2m/7ft radius that last for 1 turn.

3.name: Cloak of Displacement
3.description: Cloak of Displacement is a rare Cloak that, every turn, subjects enemy attacks against its wearer to Disadvantage until the wearer takes damage.
3.quote: The fur is so blue as to be almost black. When mantled across your shoulders, the patterns on the cloak seem to shift and ripple.

effects.name: Displacement
effects.description: At the beginning of the wearer's turn, the cloak activates, granting enemies Disadvantage on Attack Rolls that target the wearer. This effect lasts until the wearer takes damage.

3.name: Cloak of Elemental Absorption
3.icon: Cloak of Elemental Absorption Unfaded Icon.png
3.description: Cloak of Elemental Absorbtion is an uncommon Cloak that allows the wearer to absorb a small amount of magical damage, and add it to their next attack.
3.quote: A favourite among flee-footed gish, this cloak allows the wearer to wield a foe's elemental mastery against them.

effects.name: Absorb Elements|w=40
effects.description: Absorb elemental damage once per Short Rest. Take half damage from the next elemental attack targeting you, and deal an additional d6|Piercing 1d6 of that element type on your next attack.

3.quote:
Wizard Otiluke and Bigby may be renowned as dignified members of the Circle of Eight, but on one occasion, as younger men, Bigby bet Otiluke that he couldn't suck thirteen litres of vodka out of a protection cloak like this one.

Bigby won.

3.name: Cloak of the Weave
3.icon: Cloak of the Weave Unfaded Icon.png
3.description: Cloak of the Weave is a very rare Cloak that allows the wearer to absorb a small amount of magical damage, and add it to their next attack. It also gives better Spell Save DC and Spell Attack Rolls.
3.quote: Part of an outfit worn by the wizard Tenser when he was inducted into the organization of eminent wizards called the Circle of Eight.

effects.name: Absorb Elements|w=40

effects.name: Deadly Derivation

3.name: Fleshmelter Cloak
3.description: Fleshmelter Cloak is an uncommon Cloak that deals acid damage to creatures that deal melee damage to the wearer.
3.quote: Droplets of foul acid drip from the tails of this cloak, as if from the stinger of a demonic scorpion.

effects.name: Crusader's Mantle|w=40
effects.description: Can cast at Level 3, once per Long Rest.

3.quote: The charmers, seducers, philanderers, flirts, gallants, beguilers, ravishers, rogues, tempters, and tantalisers of the Feywild all share one common trait: they make you feel as if you are the only diamond among the drift.

effects.name: Dominate Person|w=40

7.description: Helldusk Helmet is a very rare Helmet that can be obtained from the House of Hope.
7.quote: It is said that Carixim, the fiending titan whose flesh squirms with twenty-thousand trapped souls, forged the pieces of this armour set.

effects.name: Infernal Sight
effects.description: You can see in magical and ordinary darkness up to a range of 12m / 40ft. You cannot be Blinded.

effects.name: Magical Durability
effects.description: The wielder has a +2 bonus to Saving Throws against spells.

effects.name: Immolating Gaze|w=40

7.name: Helm of Balduran
7.description: Helm of Balduran is a legendary Headwear once worn by the fabled founder of Baldur's Gate, Balduran, and grants hit points every turn along with stun and critical hit immunities.
7.quote: This helm, worn atop the pate of Balduran the Brave, still gleams as if with the untarnished splendour of his legacy. Baldur's Gate itself bears his name, and tales of his exploits have turned the heads and hearts of many.

effects.name: Balduran's Vitality
effects.description: The helmet heals you 2|Healing at the beginning of every turn.

effects.name: Balduran's Favour
effects.description: You have a +1 bonus to Armour Class and Saving Throws.

effects.name: Stun Immunity
effects.description: You can't be Stunned.

effects.name: Anonymous Effect

7.name: Helmet of Arcane Acuity
7.icon: Helmet of Arcane Acuity Unfaded Icon.png
7.description: The Helmet of Arcane Acuity is an uncommon Helmet that causes the wearer to gain Arcane Acuity whenever they deal damage with a weapon attack.
7.quote: Subtle magics are woven into the helmet's leather panes - for a powerful offence is sometimes still the best defence.

effects.name: Battle Acuity
effects.description: Whenever you deal damage with a weapon attack, you gain Arcane Acuity for 2.

effects.name: Anonymous Effect

7.name: Helmet of Autonomy
7.description: The Helmet of Autonomy is an uncommon Helmet that grants the wearer Proficiency in Wisdom Saving Throws.
7.quote: The metal bolted to the helmet's forehead is engraved with a faded script. Though the words have become unintelligible, their magic remains.

effects.name: Anonymous Effect
effects.description: Proficiency in Wisdom Saving Throws

effects.name: Helmet of Autonomy
effects.description: Proficiency in Wisdom Saving Throws

7.name: Helmet of Grit
7.description: The Helmet of Grit is a very rare Helmet that grants the wearer an additional Bonus Action at low Hit Points.
7.quote: At the barest touch, you feel a surge of exuberance and stamina - like you could take on anyone and anything.

effects.description: When the wearer has 50% Hit Points or less, they have an additional Bonus.

effects.name: Anonymous Effect
effects.description: Dexterity Saving Throws +1

7.description: The Helmet of Smiting is an uncommon Helmet that grants the wearer Temporary Hit Points whenever they apply a Condition using a Smite spell.
7.quote: A set of runes have been expertly worked into the helmet's filigree. Almost imperceptibly - but powerful nonetheless.

effects.name: Bolstering Smite

7.name: Holy Lance Helm
7.description: A Holy Lance Helm is an uncommon Helmet that potentially deals radiant damage to creatures that attack the wearer.
7.quote: Brief halos of divine light wrap your head when you don and doff this helmet.

effects.name: Smite the Graceless
effects.description: Creatures who miss their Attack Rolls against the wearer must make a Dexterity or take 1d4|Radiant damage.

effects.name: Anonymous Effect
effects.description: Constitution Saving Throws +1

effects.description: Constitution Saving Throws +1

7.description: Hood of the Weave is a very rare Helmet that boosts its wearer's spell-related rolls.
7.quote: Worn by the wizard Tenser when he was inducted into the Circle of Eight.

effects.name: Arcane Enchantment
effects.description: You gain a +2 bonus to Spell Save DC and Spell Attack Rolls.

7.name: Horns of the Berserker
7.icon: Horns of the Berserker Unfaded Icon.png
7.description: Horns of the Berserker is a very rare Helmet that grants a +2 bonus to Necrotic damage to melee hits against damaged creatures.
7.quote: This was created by a designer and an enchanter who were going through a messy divorce at the time. As such, the armour is filled with active-aggressive rage. It also makes you feel like you've wasted the last ten years picking up after a complete tit.

effects.name: Seeking Blood
effects.description: You gain a +2 bonus to Attack Rolls when attacking creatures that have already taken damage.

effects.name: Blood Thirst
effects.description: Unarmed and melee attacks will deal an extra 2|Necrotic damage as long as you don't have your full health. If you don't deal any damage this turn, you will take 1d4|Necrotic| damage at the end of your turn.

7.name: Jannath's Hat
7.description: Jannath's Hat is a very rare headwear that gives advantage to persuasion and deception checks.
7.quote: The corner of modern fashion that this hat currently occupies might well be called Optimistic.

effects.description: Advantage on Persuasion Checks.

effects.description: Advantage on Deception Checks.

7.name: Key of the Ancients
7.icon: Key of the Ancients Unfaded Icon.png
7.description: Key of the Ancients is an uncommon Helmet that grants the wearer a bonus to Nature checks.
7.quote: The branches of this circlet are half-fossilised, passed down through generations of druids. Fabricated during the founding of the grove, the wreath is forever linked to its lands, the tiny rubies connected to its stones and structures, bidding them to do their bidding.

effects.name: Anonymous Effect
effects.description: Nature +1

effects.name: Anonymous Effect

7.name: Marksmanship Hat
7.description: Marksmanship Hat is an uncommon hat that grants its wearer a bonus to attack rolls.
7.quote: Silvery wings spread over the stiff unyielding leather.

effects.name: Marksmanship
effects.description: You gain a +1 bonus to ranged Attack Rolls (including spell attack rolls).

7.name: Mask of Soul Perception
7.icon: Mask of Soul Perception Unfaded Icon.png
7.description: Mask of Soul Perception is a very rare Helmet that increases a wearer's Attack Rolls, Initiative Rolls, and Perception Checks. The wearer can also cast Detect Thoughts once per Short Rest.
7.quote: Formerly worn by Autumnal Baskin, a professional mediator turned bare-knuckle champion, who gained enlightenment via two methods. The first was giving up her addictive reliance on secluded caves and lonely mountaintops, and getting a bit more sociable. This involved many new skirts. Most of them lavender.

effects.name: Soul Perception
effects.description: Gain a +2 bonus to Attack Rolls, Initiative Rolls, and Perception Checks.

effects.name: Detect Thoughts|w=40
effects.description: Can cast at Level 2, once per Short Rest

7.name: Mask of the Shapeshifter
7.icon: Mask of the Shapeshifter Unfaded Icon.png
7.description:
The Mask of the Shapeshifter is a legendary Mask which lets the wearer cast Disguise Self at will. This makes it highly useful for engaging other characters as a different race or avoiding being recognized by someone you killed when using Speak with Dead.

Is an exclusive item from the Digital Deluxe Upgrade, alongside other cosmetic items themed around Divinity: Original Sin II.
7.quote: The magic of this mask comes from its gory provenance and makes it perfect for the discerning actor, sleuth or person with a mirror and time to kill.

effects.name: Disguise Self|w=40
effects.description: Can cast the Disguise Self spell at will.

7.name: Pyroquickness Hat
7.description: Pyroquickness Hat is a very rare Hat that burns the wearer when casting a fire spell, but also grants them an extra Bonus Action.
7.quote: Merely holding the circlet makes your skin flush, filling you with determination and righteous fury.

effects.name: Fiery Return
effects.description: When you deal Fire damage with a leveled spell, you Burning|Burn yourself and gain an additional Bonus this round.

7.name: Sarevok's Horned Helmet
7.description: Sarevok's Horned Helmet is a very rare Headwear that grants Darkvision (Passive Feature)|Darkvision to its wearer, among other bonuses.
7.quote: The last sight Sarevok witnessed as a mortal was his sibling's knife. This duel, the first between Bhaalspawn, is worshipped still by the cult of Bhaal, who now believe that no act is more sacred than fratricide between spawn before the altar of their Dread Lord.

effects.name: Deathbringer's Sight
effects.description: You gain Darkvision (Passive Feature)|Darkvision up to a range of 10 ft / 3 m, or 50 ft / 15 m if you already have it. The number you need to roll a Critical Hit while attacking is reduced by 1. This effect can stack.

effects.name: Dauntless
effects.description: You can't be Frightened, and cannot be afflicted with other emotion-altering conditions.

effects.name: Anonymous Effect
effects.description: +1 to cons

effects.name: Sarevok's Horned Helmet
effects.description: +1 to cons

7.name: Scabby Pugilist Circlet
7.description: The Scabby Pugilist Circlet is a rare Helmet that grants additional damage on weapon and unarmed strikes while surrounded by 2 or more foes.
7.quote: Every adventuring party has at least one 'chaotic element'. In the case of one such party, this was the infamous Scabby, a barbarous goblin who was trained by monks.

effects.name: Martial Bravery
effects.description: Your weapon and Unarmed Strike|unarmed strikes deal an additional 2 damage while surrounded by 2 or more foes.

7.name: Shadow of Menzoberranzan
7.description: The Shadow of Menzoberranzan is an rare Helmet that allows the wearer to become Invisible.
7.quote: You sense the shadows that envelop this drowcraft cowl, eagerly awaiting to envelop you and shield you from view.

effects.name: Shrouded in Shadow|w=40
effects.description: Become Invisible for 2 turns. The spell breaks if you attack, cast another spell, perform an action, or take damage.

7.name: Shapeshifter Hat
7.description: Shapeshifter Hat is a very rare Headwear that grants the wearer one more Wild Shape charge per Long Rest.
7.quote: 'Trust is the most fundamental part of wild-shaping. Not trusting others, but trusting yourself. Because the assumption of an animalistic form comes part and parcel with risk - that you'll like being a beast. Like it too much. You've got to trust yourself to the extent that you're comfortable courting that danger. Trust yourself the way you trust a marital partner with your heart.' - Mac Tire, Moon Druid

effects.name: Nature's Embrace
effects.description: Increase your Wild Shape Charge by 1. This additional charge is restored upon taking a Long Rest.

effects.name: Anonymous Effect
effects.description: Nature +1

effects.name: Shapeshifter Hat
effects.description: Nature +1

7.name: Steelwatcher Helmet
7.description: Steelwatcher Helmet is a rare Helmet that grants the wearer the wearer Darkvision and immunity to Blindness. It also grants Advantage on Constitution Saving Throws.
7.quote: 'When I found Carixim, he turned to me, all those poor people's souls crammed into him like too many bees in a rotten hive, and he... He grinned at me. And he said: I been expecting you, boy.' - Overheard from the smith Dammon

effects.name: Artificial Sight
effects.description: The wearer can see in the dark up to 40ft and cannot be Blinded.

effects.name: Anonymous Effect
effects.description: Advantage on Constitution Saving Throws.

effects.name: Steelwatcher Helmet
effects.description: Advantage on Constitution Saving Throws.

7.name: The Lifebringer
7.description: The Lifebringer is an uncommon circlet that grants the wearer temporary hit points whenever they gain Lightning Charges.
7.quote: 'Lightning is like magic,' Yrre the Sparkstruck once said. 'And what is magic but life itself?'

effects.name: Life Charger
effects.description: When the wearer gains Lightning Charges, they also gain 3 Temporary Hit Points. The temporary hit points disappear if the wearer runs out of Lightning Charges.

7.name: The Pointy Hat
7.description: The Pointy Hat is a rare hat that gives the wearer a bonus to their persuasion checks.
7.quote: Sages over the course of ages have dealt very constructive and useful advice - however, none so sagacious as that of the wizard Otiluke, who once advised one of his students thusly: 'Never cast Speak with Dead on a loved one if there's unresolved tension there. It's never worth it. Trust me.'

effects.name: Glorious Pointy Hat
effects.description: You gain a bonus to your Persuasion Checks equal to your Intelligence Modifier.

7.name: The Shadespell Circlet
7.description: The Shadespell Circlet is an uncommon Helmet that grants a bonus Spell Save DC when the wearer is obscured in shadow.
7.quote: One of the relics of Deep Duerra's rebellious children. Flanked by her court, Duerra shook her head at her children. Had they really believed they could leave her?

effects.name: Shadespell
effects.description: While the wearer is obscured in shadow, their spells gain a +1 bonus to Spell Save DC, making them more likely to succeed.

7.name: Wapira's Crown
7.description: Wapira's Crown is an uncommon Helmet that heals the wearer whenever they heal another creature.
7.quote: Legends say a Giant Elk and a druid once formed a powerful friendship. When the Elk laid down his life for the druid, she crafted this helmet in honour of her beloved friend, so his beauty and compassion would live on forever.

effects.name: Crowning Glory
effects.description: When healing another, the wearer regains 1d6|Healing.

7.name: Warped Headband of Intellect
7.icon: Warped Headband of Intellect Unfaded Icon.png
7.description: The Warped Headband of Intellect is an uncommon Circlet that raises the wearer's Intelligence.
7.quote: This particular circlet is covered in yellow slime and has pieces of half-digested mutton stuck behind the gems.

effects.name: Anonymous Effect
effects.description: Set the wearer's Intelligence score to 17. The enchantment has no effect if their Intelligence score is higher without it.

effects.name: Warped Headband of Intellect
effects.description: Set the wearer's Intelligence score to 17. The enchantment has no effect if their Intelligence score is higher without it.

8.name: Armour of Landfall
8.description: Armour of Landfall is a very rare Light Armour that improves the spellcasting ability of its wearer and also gives various plant based powers.
8.quote: Smelling of long-abandoned gardens grown wild with thorny roses, moss and hibiscus, this armour was worn by a powerful druid who spent so long from people that she forgot to miss them.

effects.name: High Spellcasting
effects.description: You gain a +1 bonus to Spell Save DC.

effects.name: Plant Growth|w=40

8.name: Armour of Moonbasking
8.description: Armour of Moonbasking is a very rare Light Armour bought from Voiceless Penitent Bareki that bestows Temporary Hit Points and Armour Class to its wielder when they Wild Shape.
8.quote: This armour was designed by lunar-obsessed Cuthbertina, a gnomish arcane smith who now lives peacefully on a mountain plateau with her magical forge.

effects.name: Lunar Beastial Vitality
effects.description: You gain Healing|22 temporary hit points after casting Wild Shape. While those temporary hit points are active reduce all incoming damage by 1.

effects.name: Lunar Bestial Fortitude
effects.description: You have a +2 bonus to Armour Class. You also have Advantage on Saving Throws against spells. This effect persists while using your druidic Wild Shape ability.

8.name: Armour of the Sporekeeper
8.description: Armour of the Sporekeeper is a very rare Light Armour that enhances the wearer's Necrotic|Necrotic damage and Symbiotic Entity ability.
8.quote: According to one story, this armour was enriched by the cascading spores of a myconid sovereign, its great fungal head shimmering and twinkling as it shook upon the material.

effects.name: Malefic Funghi
effects.description: The wearer gains a +1 bonus to Spell Save DC and when dealing Necrotic damage, they deal an additional 1|Necrotic Damage.

effects.name: Spore Sacks
effects.description: While imbued with Symbiotic Entity, you can spread Bibberbang Spores, Timmask Spores (Class Action)|Timmask Spores, and Haste Spores.

8.name: Bhaalist Armour
8.description: Bhaalist Armour is a very rare Light Armour that grants an Aura of Murder and a bonus to Initiative rolls.
8.quote: Bhaal, Lord of Murder, was forced to walk the world as a mortal man during a period of history called the Time of Troubles. He was more vulnerable than he had ever been. But Bhaal was cunning. He had contingencies in case he died.

effects.name: Aura of Murder
effects.description: Enemies within m=2|ft=6.5 become Piercing|vulnerable|nocat=true Piercing}} damage, unless they are Piercing|resistant|nocat=true Resistant or Piercing|immune|nocat=true [[Immune to it.

8.quote: Even though the embroidered velvet won't help against a sharp blade, wearing it fills you with self-assuredness.

effects.name: Remedial Rhymes
effects.description: When you inspire an ally using Bardic Inspiration, you gain 4 Temporary Hit Points.

8.name: Broken Padded Armour
8.description: Broken Padded Armour is a common Light Armour.
8.quote: A standard gambeson of quilted cloth. Good for catching blows, but almost unbearably sweaty.

8.quote: Glutted with lone wolves and well-meaning scallywags, the Harpers are not averse to shadows - quite the contrary. For many such individuals, being swallow in the dark throat of the night is the only method they know or care to know.

effects.name: Forest Aegis

9.name: Breastplate
9.description: Breastplate is a common Medium Armour.
9.quote: This standard-sized breastplate is lined with thick padding meant to cushion the wearer and deflect blows from assailants. The uniform squares of the padding suggest a mathematically-mind crafter.

9.quote: Tight chains protect the wearer from many sharp weapons, while fabric padding protects the skin from cold metal.

9.description: Chain Shirt (Shadowheart) is a common Medium Armour and an alternate appearance of Chain Shirt unique to Shadowheart
9.quote: While the stitching on the shirt is rushed and uneven, the chain mail is sturdy, and the garment is decorated with an obsidian disk that seems to swallow all light.

9.description: Chain Shirt +1 is an uncommon Medium Armour
9.quote: The intricate embroidery on the linen panel of this armour indicates the nobility of its previous owner.

9.description: Chain Shirt +2 is a rare Medium Armour.
9.quote: This mail's impossibly fine, close joining indicates the work of gnomish fingers.

effects.name: Superior Material
effects.description: You take 1 less Slashing damage.

effects.name: Balance

9.name: Damaged Dark Justiciar Armour
9.description: A Medium Armour that is the degraded version of Dark Justiciar Mail. It is part of the Dark Justiciar Set.
9.quote: Though time has tarnished this armour's metal and cracked its leather, the black sheen of Shar's symbol shines eternal from its chestpiece.

9.description: Dark Justiciar Half-Plate is a rare Medium Armour that grants Advantage on Stealth checks while Obscured in shadow. It also grants Advantage on Constitution Saving Throws and allows its wearer to cast Shield of Faith once per Long Rest.
9.quote: Shar's aspect winds its way though the patterns and pauldrons of this half plate, and any light cast nearby seems to almost quiver away from it, afraid. For even the light knows that the clank of this armour is swiftly followed by the Dark Justiciar's silent blade.

9.name: Dark Justiciar Mail
9.description: Dark Justiciar Mail is an uncommon Medium Armour that deals Necrotic damage to creatures that hit the wearer with a melee attack while the wearer is Obscured by shadow.
9.quote: Though well-preserved, the armour's gleam is somewhat muted - as if half-shadowed, even in brightest day.

effects.name: Nightsinger's Reply
effects.description: While Obscured by shadow, the wearer deals 1d4|Necrotic damage to attackers that hit them with a melee attack.

9.name: Elven Chain
9.description: Elven Chain is a rare Medium Armour that grants its wearer bonuses to Initiative Rolls and Dexterity Saving Throws.
9.quote: The weight of the interwoven steel rings is offset by clever elven craftsmanship - rustling against your undershirt, the mail feels like you're wearing a cloud.

effects.name: Elven Chain
effects.description: You are considered Proficient with this armour while wearing it.

effects.name: Elven Agility
effects.description: The wearer has a +2 bonus to Initiative Rolls and Advantage on Dexterity Saving Throws

9.name: Flame Enamelled Armour
9.description: Flame Enamelled Armour is a very rare Medium Armour.
9.quote: The air around this armour shimmers, oven-hot. From the seams of the armour you can hear a red-tinted rumble, like coals digesting in a furnace.

effects.name: Seldom Caught Unawares
effects.description: You gain a +2 bonus to Initiative rolls.

effects.name: Endurance by Fire
effects.description: You have Fire|double|nocat=true Resistance to Fire damage and a +2 bonus to SavingThrows.

effects.name: Fire Shield (Warm)|w=40
effects.description: Can cast Fire Shield (Warm) once per Long Rest.

9.name: Githyanki Half Plate
9.description: Githyanki Half Plate is a common Medium Armour worn by the Githyanki.
9.quote: This armour was forged to Vlaakith's standards under the exacting eye of a githyanki smith.

9.name: Half Plate Armour
9.description: Half Plate Armour is a common Medium Armour.
9.quote: This heavy, resilient breastplate is reinforced by a padded gamberson to protect soldiers from hip to neck.

9.name: Half Plate Armour +1
9.description: Half Plate Armour +1 is a uncommon Medium Armour.
9.quote: Heraldic runes are sewn into the padding of this armour, offering a gift of protection to whoever dons it.

effects.name: Superior Plate
effects.description: You take 1 less Piercing damage.

9.name: Half Plate Armour +2
9.icon: Half Plate Armour PlusTwo Unfaded Icon.png
9.description: Half Plate Armour +2 is a rare Medium Armour.
9.quote: This breastplate is far tougher than it appears, taking blows from common weapons without suffering so much as a scratch.

effects.name: Superior Plate
effects.description: You take 2 less Piercing damage.

9.name: Hedge Wanderer Armour
9.description: The Hedge Wanderer Armour is an uncommon Medium Armour that provides a small boost to Skill Checks.
9.quote: This simple cured goat hide was enchanted by a travelling druid. A goatherd once helped her negotiate a strange maze of hedges, so she blessed all his goats in thanks.

effects.name: Balance
effects.description: Gain a +1 bonus to Dexterity SavingThrows and Ability Checks.

9.name: Hide Armour
9.description: Hide Armour is a common Medium Armour.
9.quote: Constructed from carefully-chosen animal hides tanned, hardened and varnished to a gleaming finish.

9.name: Hide Armour +1
9.description: Hide Armour +1 is a uncommon Medium Armour.
9.quote: Tight stitches bind panels of hard leather into a formfitting carapace that moves like a second skin.

effects.name: Balance
effects.description: Gain a +1 bonus to Dexterity SavingThrows and Checks

9.name: Hide Armour +2
9.description: Hide Armour +2 is a rare Medium Armour.
9.quote: This hide armour, soft to the touch but hard as a zaratan's hide, is stitched together of narrow panels allowing for the wearer's ease of movement and comfort.

effects.name: Balance
effects.description: Gain a +1 bonus to Dexterity SavingThrows and Ability Checks.

effects.name: Ambusher
effects.description: Gain a +1 bonus to Initiative Rolls.

9.name: Luminous Armour
9.description: Luminous Armour is an uncommon Medium Armour that allows the wearer to cause radiant shockwaves.
9.quote: Many an adventurer has found themselves swallowed up by the dark throat of some nameless dungeon, aching for a glimpse of light.

effects.name: Radiating Shockwave
effects.description: When the wearer deals Radiant damage, they cause a Radiant Shockwave:

effects.name: Anonymous Effect
effects.description: Inflict Radiating Orb in a Aoe Icon 3 m / 10 ft radius.

effects.name: Luminous Armour
effects.description: Inflict Radiating Orb in a Aoe Icon 3 m / 10 ft radius.

9.name: Psionic Ward Armour
9.description: Psionic Ward Armour is a set of rare Medium Armour that gives the wearer Resistance to Psychic damage.
9.quote: After all that was done to them at the illithids' caprice, it is little wonder that the gith would construct armaments fit for combating the psionic might

effects.name: Psionic Ward
effects.description: If the item detects that the wearer is Gith, they have Psychic|double|nocat=true Resistance to Psychic damage.

effects.description: Whenever the wearer succeeds on a SavingThrow against a spell, they regain 1d4|Healing.

effects.name: Psionic Ward Armour
effects.description: Whenever the wearer succeeds on a SavingThrow against a spell, they regain 1d4|Healing.

9.name: Robust Chain Shirt
9.description: The Robust Chain Shirt is an uncommon Medium Armour that deals Piercing|Piercing damage to enemies that damage the wearer with a melee attack while the wearer is greatly injured.
9.quote: A multitude of names is embroidered on the inside collar - the lives of those this shirt has saved.

effects.name: Piercing Counter
effects.description: When the wearer has 50% Hit Points or less and is damaged by a melee attack, they deal 1d4|Piercing damage to the attacker.

9.name: Scale Mail
9.description: Scale Mail is a common Medium Armour.
9.quote: A hefty shirt of scale, offering some protection against the slings and arrows of the world.

9.name: Scale Mail +1
9.icon: Scale Mail B PlusOne Unfaded Icon.png
9.description: Scale Mail +1 is a uncommon Medium Armour.
9.quote: The work of a skilled craftsman, this scale shirt offers better protection than most.

effects.name: Superior Material
effects.description: You take 1 less Slashing damage.

9.name: Scale Mail +2
9.description: Scale Mail +2 is a rare Medium Armour.
9.quote: Crafted by an artist's hands, this exquisite scale shirt feels like it could turn aside any blade.

effects.name: Superior Material
effects.description: You take 1 less Slashing damage.

effects.name: Ambusher
effects.description: You gain +1 to Initiative Rolls.

9.name: Scale Mail Armour +1
9.description: Scale Mail +1 is an uncommon Medium Armour.
9.quote: The work of a skilled craftsman, this scale shirt offers better protection than most.

9.name: Scale Mail of Devotion
9.icon: Scale Mail of Devotion Unfaded Icon.png
9.description: The Scale Mail of Devotion is a common Medium Armour.
9.quote: Embroidered on the tabard are the tenets of devotion: Honesty, Courage, Compassion, Honour, and Duty.

9.name: Scale Mail of Vengeance
9.icon: Scale Mail of Vengeance Unfaded Icon.png
9.description: The Scale Mail of Vengeance is a common Medium Armour.
9.quote: Gold embroidery covers the inside of the tabard, right over the heart: 'By any means necessary, I will fight the Greater Evil, showing no mercy for the wicked.'

9.name: Scale Mail of the Ancients
9.image: Scale Male of the Ancients Icon.png
9.icon: Scale Mail of the Ancients Unfaded Icon.png
9.description: The Scale Mail of the Ancients is a common Medium Armour.
9.quote: Four embroidered sentences decorate the tabard - the tenets of the ancients: 'Kindle the Light. Shelter the Light. Preserve your own Light. Be the Light.'

9.name: Sharpened Snare Cuirass
9.description: Sharpened Snare Cuirass is a very rare Medium Armour that adds your Dexterity Modifier to your ArmourClass.
9.quote: This magnificent hide was harvested from a rare mythological creature of the Feywild, a cross bettween a unicorn and a stoat.

effects.description: Add your Dexterity Modifier to your ArmourClass.

effects.description: Creatures have Disadvantage on SavingThrows when resisting your attacks and spells that inflict Restrained.

9.description: The Slippery Chain Shirt is an uncommon Medium Armour that allows creatures the wearer heals to move without provoking Opportunity Attacks.
9.quote: Scored with slime and blood, it seems this chain mail shirt couldn't save its previous owner. Although it may help the next.

effects.name: Cautious Healer
effects.description: When the wearer heals a creature, it automatically Disengage|Disengages and won't trigger Opportunity Attacks.

9.name: The Jolty Vest
9.description: The Jolty Vest is a rare Medium Armour that shocks enemies who land attacks on the wearer while they have Lightning Charges.
9.quote: Yrre the Sparkstruck got their nickname for both their obsession with lightning and the inventions they created, which had the habit of electrocuting both Yrre and any poor observers that got too close.

effects.name: Superior Material
effects.description: You take 1 less Slashing damage.

effects.name: Countershock
effects.description: When the wearer takes damage while having Lightning Charges, the attacker must succeed a Dexterity|dc=14 or become Shocked.

9.name: The Oakfather's Embrace
9.description: The Oakfather's Embrace is an uncommon Medium Armour that deals Radiant|Radiant damage to creatures violating the natural order, including the wearer.
9.quote: Embroidered with a simple maxim - 'Nature is the True State of the World' - these hides radiate a faint divine power.

effects.name: Order of Nature
effects.description: 1d6|Radiant}} damage. [[Beasts that hit the wearer deal an additional 1d6|Radiant damage.

9.name: Unwanted Masterwork Scalemail
9.description: The Unwanted Masterwork Scalemail is a rare Medium Armour that doesn't limit your AC's Dexterity bonus. It is part of the Unwanted set.
9.quote: Nothing stings the master blacksmith more than a cancelled commission - not even molten iron. This mail is engraved with the mark of a devillish forgemaster, as well as several curses stamped out in infernal, and hums with diabolic magic.

effects.name: Exotic Material
effects.description: Add your Dexterity Modifier to your Armour Class. Additionally, this armour does not impose Disadvantage on Stealth Ability Checks.

effects.name: Anonymous Effect
effects.description: Fire|double|nocat=true Resistance to Fire damage.

effects.name: Unwanted Masterwork Scalemail
effects.description: Fire|double|nocat=true Resistance to Fire damage.

9.name: Yuan-Ti Scale Mail
9.description: Yuan-Ti Scale Mail is a rare Medium Armour that adds the wearer's Dexterity Modifier to their Armour Class.
9.quote: The Snakefolk of Chult are not known for waste, so often forge lightweight and robust armour like this from their own shed skin.

effects.name: Exotic Material
effects.description: Add your Ability Checks.

effects.name: Ambusher
effects.description: Gain a +1 bonus to Initiative Rolls.

10.name: After Death Do Us Part
10.icon: Partner Ring B Unfaded Icon.png
10.description: After Death Do Us Part is a rare Ring that allows its wearer to regain half their hit points after being Downed, but be cursed with Shadow Possession.
10.quote: Love is the last cruel leaf to fall in an autumn wide with sorrow.

10.name: Band of the Mystic Scoundrel
10.icon: Ring E Gold A 1 Unfaded Icon.png
10.description: Band of the Mystic Scoundrel is a rare Ring that grants the wearer the ability to cast illusion or enchantment spells as a bonus action after hitting a creature with a weapon attack.
10.quote: What better way to disguise one's transgressions than a quickly positioned phantasm after the deed is done?

effects.name: Illusion Quickening
effects.description: After hitting a creature with a weapon attack, you can cast enchantment spells as a Bonus.

superRegion.name: Other Locations and Planes of Existence

10.name: Bracing Band
10.icon: Ring E Silver A 1 Unfaded Icon.png
10.description: The Bracing Band is an uncommon Ring that makes the wearer more difficult to hit after they shove an enemy.
10.quote: A common ring, simple and unadorned. Though there is a certain heft to it...

effects.name: Personal Space
effects.description: After Shove|shoving an enemy, the wearer gains a +1 to their Armour Class until their next turn.

10.name: Burnished Ring
10.image: Ring A Gem A Gold 1 Faded.png
10.icon: Ring A Gem A Gold 1 Unfaded Icon.png
10.description: The Burnished Ring is a very rare Ring that allows the wearer to cast Paralyzing Ray once per Long Rest.
10.quote: A paralysing eyestalk harvested from a beholder was boiled in a broth, and poured down the throat of a dwarven ringsmith. Not one fortnight thence, he crafted this ring.

effects.name: Paralyzing Ray|w=40
effects.description: Can cast at Level 3. (Long Rest)

superRegion.name: Other Locations and Planes of Existence

10.name: Callous Glow Ring
10.icon: Ring E Gold A 1 Unfaded Icon.png

10.quote: A grudging gleam emits from this ring - more an indictment of light than an endorsement.

effects.name: Callous Glow
effects.description: The wearer deals an additional 2|Radiant damage against creatures that are illuminated.

10.name: Caustic Band
10.icon: Ring F Silver A 1 Unfaded Icon.png
10.description: Caustic Band is an uncommon Ring that grants the wearer Acid|2 Acid damage with weapon attacks.
10.quote: Adjusting this unassuming ring on your finger, you hear a faint sizzle, as of pressure being released.

effects.name: Malefic Excretion
effects.description: Your weapon attacks also deal 2|Acid damage.

10.name: Coruscation Ring
10.icon: Ring A Simple Gold 1 Unfaded Icon.png
10.description: Coruscation Ring is an uncommon Ring that inflicts Radiating Orb on creatures that the wearer deals spell damage to. The wearer must be illuminated for this effect to occur.
10.quote: Provocative light blooms from the engraved contours of this ring.

effects.name: Arcane Radiance
effects.description: When the wearer deals spell damage while illuminated by a light source, they also inflict Radiating Orb upon the target for 2.

10.name: Crusher's Ring
10.icon: Crushers Ring Unfaded Icon.png
10.description: Crusher's Ring is an uncommon Ring that grants additional speed to the wearer.
10.quote: Though caked with mud and grime, the ring smells faintly of lavender. Remarkable, considering where it's been.

effects.name: Anonymous Effect
effects.description: Movement Speed increased by 3m / 10ft.

effects.name: Crusher's Ring
effects.description: Movement Speed increased by 3m / 10ft.

10.name: Crypt Lord Ring
10.icon: Ring I Gold A 1 Unfaded Icon.png
10.description: Crypt Lord Ring is a very rare Ring that allows the wearer to cast Create Undead once per Long Rest.
10.quote: Slipping one's finger through this ring fills the senses with the waft of tombs, the urine-yellow smell of old bandages, images of dead spiders curled into husks, and the sensation of hot, slobbering breath at the nape of one's neck.

effects.name: Create Undead|w=40
effects.description: Can cast at Level 6. (Long Rest)

10.name: Djinni Ring
10.icon: Ring D 1 Unfaded Icon.png
10.description: Djinni Ring is an uncommon Ring that grants its wearer the ability to cast Mage Hand.
10.quote: The ring from the djinni who worked in the circus. Its magic certainly explains how the djinni was able to cheat at the wheel.

effects.name: Mage Hand|w=40
effects.description: Can cast the Mage Hand cantrip.

10.name: Eversight Ring
10.icon: Ring I Silver A 1 Unfaded Icon.png
10.description: Eversight Ring is an uncommon Ring that gives the wearer Immunity to Blinded|Blinded.
10.quote:
One of the relics of the Deep Duerra's rebellious children. Paranoid by nature, Duerra had erected a vast array of biting, blasting, blinding traps and safeguards to keep her enemies from gaining her sanctum. 

Of course, this also meant her children were sealed in with her by those same deadly measures.

effects.name: Blind Immunity
effects.description: The wearer cannot be Blinded.

10.name: Explorer's Ring
10.icon: Explorers Ring Unfaded Icon.png
10.description: The Explorer's Ring is an uncommon Ring that improves the wearer's knowledge of Nature and Survival.
10.quote: A radiant and remarkably preserved ring, forged from arandur metal.

effects.name: Anonymous Effect
effects.description: Nature +1

effects.description: Survival +1

10.quote: The ring's simplicity is a deceit. Its gold core is woven with iron-hard feathers from the wings of great black corvid birds, envoys of the Raven Queen.

effects.name: Anonymous Effect
effects.description: Death Saving Throws +2

effects.name: Family Ring
effects.description: Death Saving Throws +2

10.name: Fetish of Callarduran Smoothhands
10.icon: Fetish of Callarduran Smoothhands Unfaded Icon.png

10.quote: The smooth, six-pointed star on this ring is beset with small Underdark gemstones, as befits a talisman of the god of mining and patron of deep gnomes.

effects.name: Invisibility|w=40
effects.description: Can cast at Level 2. (Long Rest)

10.name: Firzu's Ring of Trading
10.icon: Ring I Unfaded Icon.png
10.description: Firzu's Ring of Trading is an uncommon Ring that grants +1 to Deception.
10.quote: Belonged to a trader Firzu. Increases Deception Checks by 1.

effects.name: Anonymous Effect

10.name: Guiding Light
10.icon: Ring D Gold A 1 Unfaded Icon.png
10.description: The Guiding Light is an uncommon Ring that allows the wearer to cast the Light cantrip.
10.quote: Used by the previous owner to access both the Underdark's darkest corners and her own basement, this ring seems to reflect light where there should be none.

effects.name: Light|w=40
effects.description: Can cast the cantrip at will.

10.name: Keepsake Ring
10.image: Ring A Gem A Gold 1 Faded.png
10.icon: Ring A Gem A Gold 1 Unfaded Icon.png

10.quote: Created by a conglomerate of druids one moonlit night when all the stirring violins of insect, elms, and whispering winds consorted, and when wild beasts in need of taming prowled unseen.

effects.name: Dominate Beast|w=40
effects.description: Can cast at Level 5. (Long Rest)

10.name: Killer's Sweetheart

10.name: Mage's Friend
10.icon: Ring C Silver A Unfaded Icon.png

10.quote: Though carefully stowed in a bedside chat, this ring is covered in dust and cobwebs.

effects.name: Anonymous Effect

Arcana +1

10.name: Orphic Ring

10.icon: Ring B Gem B Gold 1 Unfaded Icon.png

10.quote: When light catches this ring at the right angle, it pulses with a dizzying, intoxicating glow befitting the jewellery of the Prince of the Comet.

effects.name: Confusion|w=40

10.quote: Strange, green fumes seep from the ring's emerald.

10.name: Ring of Absolute Force

10.quote: Darkness seems to blossom from this ring, heightened by the menacing glare of the Absolute's symbol, though for the Branded this symbol holds the promise of power.

10.name: Ring of Arcane Synergy
10.icon: Ring B Silver A 1 Unfaded Icon.png

10.quote: The sharp silver corners of this ring almost cut into the stone set in its centre - a gem of which you've never seen the like before.

effects.name: Synergetic Cantrip

10.name: Ring of Blink
10.image: Ring A Gem A Gold 1 Faded.png
10.icon: Ring A Gem A Gold 1 Unfaded Icon.png
10.description: The Ring of Blink is a rare Ring that allows the wearer to cast Blink once per Long Rest.
10.quote: Fashioned by the wizard Bigby in honour of his faithful hound Bigboy, who could use teleportation to fetch, snare errant cats, and generally harass postmen.

effects.name: Blink|w=40

10.name: Ring of Colour Spray

10.description: Ring of Colour Spray is an uncommon Ring that allows the wearer to cast the Colour Spray spell once per short rest.
10.quote: When the light hits it just so, the centre jewel shimmers with every colour of the rainbow.

effects.name: Colour Spray

10.name: Ring of Elemental Infusion

10.quote: The mysterious gem set in this ring seems to change hues whenever you aren't looking.

effects.name: Elemental Infusion

10.name: Ring of Evasion
10.icon: Ring of Evasion Unfaded Icon.png
10.description: Ring of Evasion is a very rare Ring that grants the wearer Dextrous Evasion.
10.quote: Decorated with a hummingbird wrought of jade and sapphire, this ring evokes the sheer wonderful quickness of that animal.

effects.name: Ghoulish Touch|w=40

10.name: Ring of Feywild Sparks
10.icon: Ring H Gold A 1 Unfaded Icon.png
10.description: Ring of Feywild Sparks is a very rare Ring that forces Wild Magic Surges to always trigger while Tides of Chaos feature is active.
10.quote: This otherwise unassuming ring ties a spellcaster indelibly to the sporadic arcana of the Faerie realm.

effects.name: Feywild Sparks
effects.description: While your sorcerous Tides of Chaos feature is active, you will always trigger a Wild Magic Surge when casting spells.

10.name: Ring of Flinging
10.icon: Ring C Silver A Unfaded Icon.png
10.description: Ring of Flinging is an uncommon Ring that improves the throwing damage.
10.quote: Organisations like the Harpers do not relegate their activities to head-to-head combat - many a moonlit chase with an evildoer has been resolved with a loose roof tile and a decent throwing arm.

effects.name: Throwing Boost
effects.description: The wearer gains a d4|Slashing 1d4 bonus to Throw damage.

10.name: Ring of Free Action
10.icon: Ring of Free Action Unfaded Icon.png
10.description: Ring of Free Action is a rare Ring that allows the wearer to ignore the effects of Difficult Terrain and gives them immunity to being Paralysed or Restrained.
10.quote: The heart of the gem seems to flow like liquid - yet it contains neither quicksilver nor mercury.

10.name: Ring of Geniality
10.icon: Ring H Silver A 1 Unfaded Icon.png
10.description: Ring of Geniality is an uncommon Ring that grants a boost to Persuasion and Deception.
10.quote: Glibness is not only in the tongue, but in the body. Gesture is powerful. Think of how many words of comfort can be stored and saved, when a hug will do just as sweetly.

10.name: Ring of Jumping
10.icon: Ring of Jumping Unfaded Icon.png
10.description: Ring of Jumping is an uncommon Ring that grants the wearer the ability to cast Enhance Leap once per Short Rest.
10.quote: The ring is scuffed and twisted out of shape, as if worn by big stony fingers. The owner of those fingers has carved 'Karthol' into the warped metal in a fit of affection or possessiveness.

effects.name: Enhance Leap|w=40
effects.description: Can cast Bonus}} once per [[Short Rest.

10.name: Ring of Mental Inhibition
10.icon: Ring B 1 Unfaded Icon.png
10.description: Ring of Mental Inhibition is an uncommon Ring that grants the wearer gives a mentally weakening condition on enemies who fail to Save against spells and abilities.
10.quote: The patterns in the ring's swirling metal make your head spin whenever you look at them for too long.

effects.name: Mental Inhibition
effects.description: When a foe fails a Saving Throw against one of your spells or actions, they gain Mental Fatigue for 2.

10.name: Ring of Mind-Shielding

effects.name: Shelter
effects.description: You have Advantage on Saving Throws against being Charmed.

10.name: Ring of Poison Resistance

10.name: Ring of Regeneration
10.icon: Ring of Regeneration Unfaded Icon.png

effects.name: Combat Regeneration
effects.description: At the beginning of your turn, the ring activates and heals you 1d4|Healing.

10.name: Ring of Salving
10.icon: Ring D Silver A 1 Unfaded Icon.png
10.description: The Ring of Salving is an uncommon Ring that restore addtional hit points every time the wearer heals another creature.

effects.name: Saviour's Allure
effects.description: You restore an additional 2|Healing every time you heal another creature.

10.name: Ring of Self Immolation

10.name: Ring of Shadows
10.icon: Ring I Silver A Unfaded Icon.png
10.description: The Ring of Shadows is an uncommon Ring that grants its wearer the ability to cast Pass Without Trace once per Long Rest.
10.quote: For some, darkness is wielded like a black opal stud embedded in a signet ring - fashioned to a sharp and unforgiving point.

effects.name: Pass Without Trace|w=40
effects.description: Can cast at Level 2. (Long Rest)

10.name: Ring of Spiteful Thunder

10.description: The Ring of Spiteful Thunder is a uncommon Ring that Dazed|Dazes when the wearer deals Thunder damage to Reverberating creatures.
10.quote: When you slip this ring on your hand and flex your fingers, a boom of discontented thunder grumbles in the air around you.

effects.name: Ring of Veracity
effects.description: You gain an Advantage on Insight Checks.

10.name: Seemingly Gleaming Ring

10.name: Shadow Blade Ring

effects.name: Shadow Blade|w=40
effects.description: Can cast at Level 2. (Short Rest)

10.name: Shifting Corpus Ring

effects.description: Can cast at Level 2, once per Long Rest.

11.name: Watcher's Shield
11.description: Watcher's Shield is an uncommon Shield that gives the wielder advantage on Perception Checks.
11.quote: To hold this shield is to be vigilant in duty, wary of danger, and mindful in crisis.

effects.name: Anonymous Effect
effects.description: Advantage on Perception Checks

effects.name: Watcher's Shield
effects.description: Advantage on Perception Checks

11.name: Wood Woad Shield
11.description: Wood Woad Shield is a common Shield found on Wood Woads and grants its wearer the ability to cast Woad's Ensnaring Strike.
11.quote: 'And with her arm the dryad linked a man who had once been her lover, and once of flesh and bone. Now his flesh was bark, and his bone heartwood. In his eyes a feverish love still blazed like a thousand fireflies in a spring meadow.'

effects.name: Woad's Ensnaring Strike
effects.description: Your attack summons thorny vines that possibly Ensnared|Ensnare your target.

effects.name: Anonymous Effect
effects.description: Bonus

effects.name: Anonymous Effect
effects.description: Short Rest

effects.name: Wood Woad Shield
effects.description:
Bonus
Short Rest

12.name: Battleaxe
12.quote: Tiny scratches mar the metal -- a testament of someone sharpening this axe over and over.

12.name: Battleaxe +1
12.quote: The intricate engravings on this axe's blade and handle make plain the skill of its smith.

12.name: Ceremonial Battleaxe
12.description:
Ceremonial Battleaxe is an uncommon, lightly enchanted (+1) variant of the Battleaxes family of weapons. It is a martial melee weapon that can be wielded in one hand, or with both hands for extra damage.
While it seems to be exactly the same as a Battleaxe +1, it is used for solving the puzzle inside the chapel.
12.quote: The intricate engravings on this axe's blade and handle make plain the skill of its smith.

12.name: Combination Axe
12.quote: The intricate engravings on this axe's blade and handle make plain the skill of its smith.

effects.name: Critical Virtuoso
effects.description: When you score a Critical Hit you can spend a Bonus Action to make an additional attack.

12.name: Thermodynamo Axe
12.description: Thermodynamo Axe is a rare, lightly enchanted (+1) Battleaxe that grants Heat whenever the wielder deals damage with this weapon and an unique weapon action, Maiming Strike (Weapon Action).
12.quote: Designed by gnomish innovation, this weapon has a dynamic core that swivels and tinkles into life whenever the axe is swung at a foe.

effects.name: Thermodynamo
effects.description: Whenever you deal damage with this weapon, you gain 2 turns of Heat (Per attack).

12.name: Vicious Battleaxe
12.description:
Vicious Battleaxe is a rare Battleaxe that deals additional damage on a Critical Hit.
SpoilerWarning
12.quote: A pulse of magic shoots through your hands whenever you touch this axe.

effects.name: Dolor Amarus
effects.description: When you land a Critical Hit with this weapon, it deals an additional 7 damage.

12.name: Witchbreaker
12.description: Witchbreaker is an uncommon, lightly enchanted (+1) Battleaxe that grants Advantage against concentrating foes and has a unique weapon action, Hush You!.
12.quote: Thou shalt not suffer a witch to... well, keep doing whatever she's doing. It's probably malefic, involving toads and... and things.

effects.name: Witchbreaker
effects.description: You gain Advantage on Attack Rolls against concentrating creatures.

13.name: Club
13.description: Club is a mundane, nonmagical variant of the simple melee weapon wielded in one hand. It's a light weapon that anyone can dual-wield without special training. It is more or less a temporary weapon considering other simple weapons like Mace are superior to it in damage.
13.quote: A long, deep crack runs through the side of the wood, filled with crusted blood.

13.name: Club of Hill Giant Strength
13.description: Club of Hill Giant Strength is an uncommon club that that raises the wearer's Strength.
13.quote: Though this rotting chair leg doesn't look like much, every splinter vibrates with barely-contained power.

effects.name: Splinters of a Giant's Might
effects.description: Increases Strength to 19.

13.name: Cultist Brand
13.quote: Wrought from a single piece of twisted iron. Bits of charred flesh cling to the strange symbol shaped at the end.

13.name: Enforcer Club
13.quote: Sometimes the blunt application of fear (and, admittedly, some winging elbows) is the difference between continued chaos and the re-establishment or order.

effects.name: Non-Lethality
effects.description: This weapon deals only Non-Lethal Damage.

13.name: Ironwood Club
13.icon: Wood Woad Twisting Branch Unfaded Icon.png
13.quote: Fashioned from the hard, unforgiving trunk of an oak, this club still retains the perfume of the forest.

13.name: Lantern
13.description: Lantern is utility item as a light source and doubles as improvised weapon of the simple melee weapon wielded in one hand. It's a works exactly like a Torch in utility and combat functions.
13.quote: A deep oily smell wafts from this crude tree branch.

13.name: Moonlantern
13.description: Moonlantern is a lantern that can be used as a Club. This item will give the wielder and all creatures in a radius protection from the Shadow Curse found in Act Two.
13.quote: Each framed facet of the lantern glass is pierced by lances and long tendrils of eerily beautiful moonlight.

13.name: Salami
13.quote: A boon to any adventurer - delicious, long-lasting, and hard enough to smack an adversary.

13.name: Shadow Lantern
13.description: Shadow Lantern is a unique type of Moonlantern which does not produce light and grants a unique summoning spell.
13.quote: Encased in a cocoon of shadow within the lantern, the mangled pixie lies like some deformed pupa, its mouth slack, and those same shadows crawling over its graying tongue.

effects.name: Conjure Shadow Lantern Wraith|w=40
effects.description: Can cast once per Long Rest.

13.name: Torch
13.description: Torch is utility item as a light source and doubles as improvised weapon of the simple melee weapon wielded in one hand. It's a light weapon that anyone can dual-wield without special training. Can ignite flammable surfaces or clouds if it makes proper contact.
13.quote: A deep oily smell wafts from this crude tree branch.

13.name: Torch of Revocation
13.description: Torch of Revocation is a very rare, lightly enchanted (+1) variant of the Clubs family of weapons used in exorcisms.
13.quote: This staple of any worthwhile exorcist burns with a pale flame that destroys the anchors of troublesome ghosts in need of banishment.

13.name: Twisting Branch
13.icon: Wood Woad Twisting Branch Unfaded Icon.png
13.quote: A thick, gnarled branch, grown into a club-like shape.

13.name: Whipping Cane
13.quote: A cane designed to inflict a sharp and agonizing pain with every blow.

14.name: Artificial Leech
14.quote: Though blood and age have rusted the mechanism, a good twist can still make the blades on this bloodletting device spin.

14.name: Assassin's Touch
14.description: Assassin's Touch is an uncommon dagger with a +1 Sleeping targets.
14.quote: This long, slender blade fits perfectly between the ribs of any unsuspecting victim.

effects.name: Deathly Slumber
effects.description: Deals an additional 1d4|Necrotic damage to creatures that are Knocked Out or Sleeping.

14.name: Bloodthirst
14.description: Bloodthirst is a legendary Dagger wielded by Orin that makes critical hits more likely and allows the wielder to cast True Strike Icon|True Strike.
14.quote: The Lord of Murder wasn't always a lord. He was once just a petty killer. When Bhaal first drew blood in a Baldurian back-alley, it dropped to the ground and lingered. When he ascended, this dried blood-drop grew, warped - and became sharp.

effects.name: Improved Critical
effects.description: The number you need to roll a Critical Hit while attacking is reduced by 1. This effect can stack.

effects.name: Bound Weapon Condition Icon|Bound Weapon (Condition)|Bound Weapon
effects.description: Main Hand Only

effects.name: Exploit Weakness
effects.description: Creatures hit with this weapon receive Vulnerability to Piercing damage.

effects.name: True Strike Riposte
effects.description: When a creature misses you with a melee attack, you may retaliate and gain True Strike.

effects.name: Anonymous Effect
effects.description: True Strike|w=40 (bonus):''' Cast as a cantrip (Short Rest.

effects.name: Bloodthirst
effects.description: True Strike|w=40 (bonus):''' Cast as a cantrip (Short Rest.

14.name: Cold Snap
14.quote: In the steel, you can see small ice formations like bubbles in a bath, and even hear them pop with crickling crackles of forest delight.

effects.name: Chilling Counter
effects.description: When a creature misses you with an attack, it must succeed a DC 13 Constitution Saving Throw or be Chilled for 2 turns.

effects.name: Anonymous Effect
effects.description: Off-Hand Only

effects.name: Cold Snap
effects.description: Off-Hand Only

14.name: Dagger
14.quote: A rogue's favourite toy.

14.name: Dagger +1
14.quote: This dagger's handle is smooth and light, its jagged blade sharpened into a thin, cruel edge.

14.name: Dagger +2
14.quote: A light, slender blade, magically honed to stay razor-sharp.

14.name: Dolor Amarus
14.description:
Dolor Amarus is a rare Dagger that deals additional damage on a Critical Hit. Dolor Amarus is Latin for 'Bitter Pain'.
SpoilerWarning
14.quote: Once wielded by a murderer, the weapon's handle retains an eerie, clammy warmth, as if Dolor's pre-slaughter sweat somehow crept into the leather - and lingers there still.

effects.name: Dolor Amarus
effects.description: When you land a Critical Hit with this weapon, it deals an additional 7 damage.

14.name: Dread Iron Dagger
14.description:
Dread Iron Dagger is a rare Dagger that deals extra Necrotic damage while the wielder is Hiding|Hidden.
SpoilerWarning
14.quote: A web of veins runs the length of the blade - it has become a slender iron mortuary for all the innocents it has tasted.

effects.name: Dread Iron Ambush
effects.description: While its wielder is Hiding|Hidden, this weapon deals an extra 1d6|Necrotic damage.

14.name: Gleamdance Dagger
14.quote: A pair of pixie wings were used to create this pretty blade - their delicate tracings can be seen all day and night, though they shine brightest by the light of a gibbous moon.

effects.name: Gleamdance Dagger: Glowing
effects.description: This object shines with a glowing light in a radius of 6m.

effects.name: Gleamdancer
effects.description: When this dagger is wielded in the off-hand, the wielder gains a +1 bonus to ArmourClass.

14.name: Hunter's Dagger
14.quote: Prey often thinks it has escaped the worst of the predator's bloodthirst and fury - but there are always further torments to be meted out.

effects.name: Rupturing
effects.description: On a hit, the target must succeed a DC 13 Constitution Saving Throw or become Ruptured.

14.name: Murderous Cut
14.quote: Odd to think that dark gods like Bhaal were once mortal. One wonders if they ever thumbed a wagon ride, thought about the weather, or ate flavoured yoghurt.

effects.name: Prey Upon the Weak
effects.description: This weapon deals an additional Piercing|1~4 Piercing damage against targets with 50% of their hit points or fewer.

14.name: Needle of the Outlaw Rogue
14.image: Needle of the Outlaw Rogue Faded.png
14.icon: Needle of the Outlaw Rogue Unfaded Icon.png
14.quote: A dagger that thrums with desire - a longing for vengeance.

14.name: Polished Dagger
14.quote: The dagger's leather grip is stamped with a stag's head - the symbol of the Emerald Enclave.

14.name: Poo-Scraper
14.quote: Fecund and revolting, the Abyss is not the worst place this has been.

14.name: Promise
14.quote: A leafy pattern is carved into the dagger's blade. It glows faintly in the dark.

effects.name: Shadow Blade
effects.description: You have Advantage on Attack Rolls against Lightly or Heavily Obscured targets when using this blade.

14.name: Rhapsody
14.description: Rhapsody is a very rare, lightly enchanted (+1) special variant of the Bleeding}} while the wielder is [[Hide|Hiding or Invisible.
14.quote: Cazador's love of poetry arose after he read on the naked stomach of a dead child in his homeland. The child was hung from the lowest branch of a tree. Cazador read the poem, and looked at the child, and he knew that here was the artform for him.

effects.name: Scarlet Remittance
effects.description: Gain a +1 bonus to Attack Rolls, damage, and Spell Save DC for every foenotes you slay, up to a maximum of +3.

effects.name: Scarlet Saturation|w=40
effects.description: If you have a +3 bonus from Scarlet Remittance, consume it to make your next attack a Critical Hit (Long rest).

effects.name: Scarlet Stupor|w=40
effects.description: If you have a +3 bonus from Scarlet Remittance, consume it to give hostile creatures disadvantage on saving throws against your spells (Long rest).
