effects.name: Scarlet Regeneration|w=40
effects.description: If you have a +3 bonus from Scarlet Remittance, consume it to regain 3d10|Healing (Long Rest).

effects.name: Sweet Bloodletting
effects.description: Possibly inflict Bleeding when hitting a creature with this weapon while Hiding or Invisible.

14.name: Ritual Dagger
14.description: Ritual Dagger is an uncommon dagger that temporarily Blesses the wielder when dealing damage to an enemy - or to themselves.
14.quote: The leader handle is smooth with use, and slick with fresh blood.

effects.name: The Pain Maiden's Blessing
effects.description: After a successful attack with this dagger, the wielder receives a +1d4 bonus to Attack Rolls and Saving Throws until the end of their next turn.

effects.name: Blood Sacrifice|w=40 (bonus)
effects.description: Pain is a path to power. Take 1d4|Slashing damage to receive a +1d4 bonus to Attack Rolls and Saving Throws.

14.name: Ritual Dagger of Shar
14.description: Ritual Dagger of Shar is an uncommon +1 Dagger that deals an additional Necrotic|1d4 Necrotic damage on a hit.
14.quote: The blade is sharp, and the handle firm. Yet death exudes from this dagger as it might from a fresh corpse.

14.name: Rusty Dagger
14.quote: Useful for writing your name in damp slush and not much else.

14.name: Stillmaker
14.description: Stillmaker is a very rare, moderately enchanted (+2) variant of the Daggers family of weapons that grants the wielder the Hold Person Icon|Hold Person spell.
14.quote: The dagger's twisting blade is designed to nick the flesh as many times as possible, allowing its paralytic poison to flow effortlessly into any unfortunate target.

effects.name: Anonymous Effect
effects.description: Hold Person|w=40: Can cast at 3rd level, once per Long Rest.

effects.name: Stillmaker
effects.description: Hold Person|w=40: Can cast at 3rd level, once per Long Rest.

14.name: Sussur Dagger
14.description: The Sussur Dagger is a rare +1 Dagger that Silenced|silences the targets it strikes, making it very effective against spellcasters.
14.quote: Smoke-like whorls of sussur sap darken the metal of this dagger's blade and silence its victims.

effects.name: Anonymous Effect
effects.description: Silenced|Silences targets on hit.

effects.name: Sussur Dagger
effects.description: Silenced|Silences targets on hit.

14.name: Syringe
14.quote: The yellowish-green ooze dried to the syringe's long needle gives you the distinct impression that this medical device was never used to heal anyone.

14.name: Worgfang
14.description: Worgfang is an uncommon dagger that grants the wielder defensive capabilities against Goblins.  Any goblin attacking the wielder of Worgfang suffers from disadvantage on its Attack Rolls.
14.quote: ‘No goblin will strike you down’ is etched into this dagger's handle.  When goblin assailants realised they couldn't kill the dagger's original owner, they gave him to the worgs, who made short work of him.

effects.name: Goblin's Undoing
effects.description: Goblins have Disadvantage on Attack Rolls against the wielder.

15.name: Dart
15.quote: A well-used dart, its stained feathers slightly bent.

15.name: Dart +1
15.quote: A dart made of lightweight wood, its feathers carefully cut at a sharp angle.

16.name: Corrosive Flail
16.description: Corrosive Flail is a rare Flail with a +1 Enchantment and grants a special weapon action, Corrosive Strike.
16.quote: Acid was long ago abandoned by assassins, who found poison much more reliable in spiking their target's drinks. The acid kept melting the chalices.

16.name: Defender Flail
16.description: The Defender Flail is a rare Flail with a +1 Enchantment that reduces weapon damage to the wearer and increases Armour Class.
16.quote: This flail was created to commemorate victory over the devil Belhifet. It has since made its way so far from Easthaven that the locals have long forgotten that chapter of their town's past.

effects.name: Steel Physiology
effects.description: Reduce incoming Bludgeoning, Piercing, and Slashing damage by 1.

16.name: Flail
16.quote: A browning piece of brain sticks stubbornly to one of the spikes.

16.name: Flail of Ages
16.description: Flail of Ages is a rare Flail that applies variable conditions depending on what type of damage the fail does.
16.quote: Created by a warmongering rakshasa and kept for a time under the careful watch of an astute noble name Lord de'Arnise, this flail is a tool of absolute destruction, and a versatile one at that.

effects.name: Elements of an Epoch
effects.description: Depending on what kind of damage this weapon does, it also inflicts: Acid, Chilled, or Burning (CON|dc=13).

effects.name: Elemental Age|w=40
effects.description: Cast as a level 3 spell (Long Rest).

effects.name: Tenacity
effects.description: Main Hand Only. When you miss an attack, you deal 1 bludgeoning damage anyways.

16.name: Flail of Myrkul
16.quote: A browning piece of brain sticks stubbornly to one of the spikes.

16.name: Flail of the Vortex
16.icon: Flail of the Vortex Unfaded Icon.png

effects.name: Electrified Flail|w=40
effects.description: Clout a foe with your lightning-suffused flail and Stunned|Stun them.

16.name: Myrkulite Scourge
16.description: Myrkulite Scourge is an uncommon Flail with a +1 Enchantment and deals an additional Necrotic|1d6 Necrotic damage on a strike.
16.quote: A browning piece of brain sticks stubbornly to one of the spikes.

16.name: Planeslayer Flail
16.quote: Passed from hand to hand by those who hunt creatures from beyond the Material Plane, this flail has two words scrawled on it: 'No Trespassing.'

effects.name: Outer-Entity Slayer
effects.description: When wielding against Fey, Fiends, or Undead foes, this weapon has a +1d4 bonus to Damage and Attack Rolls.

17.name: Drakethroat Glaive
17.description: Drakethroat Glaive is a rare glaive that grants its wielder the Draconic Elemental Weapon weapon action and a bonus to dragonborn breath racial actions.
17.quote: Kereska, the draconic goddess of arcane knowledge, gifted this glaive to a dragonborn when facing off against a group of carbuncular spiders. How their arachnid legs curled and blackened before that night's dark business was done!

effects.name: Vicious Dragon Breath
effects.description: Enemies have Disadvantage on Saving Throws against your dragonborn breath weapon.

effects.name: Draconic Elemental Weapon|w=40
effects.description: Imbue a weapon with elemental power. It receives a +1 bonus to Attack Rolls, and deals an additional d4|Physical 1d4 damage of your choice (Long Rest).

17.name: Glaive
17.description: Glaive is a common variant of the Glaives family of weapons.
17.quote: Simple but sharp.  The shaft of this glaive is worn smooth with use.

17.name: Glaive +1
17.description: Glaive +1 is an uncommon, lightly enchanted glaive.
17.quote: Fashioned by expert elven hands to be both deadly and beautiful.

17.name: Monster Slayer Glaive
17.description: Monster Slayer Glaive is a rare glaive that deals additional damage against Monstrosities and increases its wielder's Jump (Bonus Action)|Jump distance.
17.quote: Monster-slaying is a rare calling, not for the faint of heart. It requires temperance, discipline, and usually a very big stick with something pointy at the end. The best thing about spears is that the ugly parts of combat are happening at the other end.

effects.name: Monsterslayer
effects.description: This weapon deals an additional d4|Physical 1d4 damage against Monstrosity type foes.

effects.name: Refined Vaulting
effects.description: Jump (Bonus Action)|Jump distance is increased by 1.5 m / 5 ft.

17.name: Moonlight Glaive
17.description: Moonlight Glaive is a rare glaive that deals additional |Radiant damage, has a permanent Light effect, and grants its wielder the Moonlight Butterflies weapon action.
17.quote: A gift from Dame Aylin and her radiant goddess, this weapon's contours hold a silver-white beauty akin to the nightly lantern that climbs the firmament each evening.

effects.name: Anonymous Effect
effects.description: Light|w=40 Moonlight Glaive: Glowing: This object shines with a glowing light in a radius of 6 m / 20 ft.

effects.name: Moonlight Glaive
effects.description: Light|w=40 Moonlight Glaive: Glowing: This object shines with a glowing light in a radius of 6 m / 20 ft.

17.name: Sorrow
17.description: Sorrow is a rare glaive that grants its wielder the Sorrowful Lash cantrip on a one turn cooldown.
17.quote: For every drop of blood spilled, a piece of the soul perishes - until nothing remains but regret.

effects.name: Sorrowful Lash|w=40
effects.description: Bonus Pulls the creature m=3|ft=10 closer to you (Per turn).

17.name: The Dancing Breeze
17.description: The Dancing Breeze is a very rare glaive that grants its wielder the Whirlwind Attack weapon action.
17.quote: Tiny specks of blood are fused into the blade, as if the glaive is feeding on them.

18.name: Blooded Greataxe
18.description: Blooded Greataxe is a rare greataxe that deals additional |Slashing damage when the wielder has 50% hp or less.
18.quote: Stained brown and reeking of iron, this greataxe once belonged to a killer so deranged, his name was magically scrubbed from all histories.

effects.name: Relentless Revenge
effects.description: When the wielder has 50% hp or less, they deal an additional 1d4|Slashing damage.

18.name: Defender Greataxe
18.description: Defender Greataxe is a rare greataxe that can be reduced in its enchantment on the first attack of the round to increase wielder's ArmourClass and SavingThrow bonus.
18.quote: The power of this axe lies in a fluctuating arcane enchantment that flows between the beard and the edge of the axe, and the wielder themselves.

effects.name: Defensive Attack
effects.description: When making your first attack of the round, you can reduce this weapon's Enchantment by 1 to increase your ArmourClass and SavingThrow bonus by 1.

18.name: Exterminator's Axe
18.description: Exterminator's Axe is an uncommon greataxe that deals additional |Fire damage to Plants, Insects, and Small creatures.
18.quote: The intricate engravings on this axe's blade and handle make plain the skill of its smith.

effects.name: Scourge of Pests
effects.description: Deals an additional 1d6|Fire damage to Plants, Insects or Small creatures.

18.name: Greataxe
18.description: Greataxe is a common variant of the Greataxes family of weapons.
18.quote: The rectangular engravings on this axe's wooden handle have been nearly scratched away by armoured hands.

18.name: Greataxe +1
18.description: Greataxe +1 is an uncommon, lightly enchanted greataxe.
18.quote: A small prayer decorates the hilt of this axe. It resonates in your head when you touch it.

18.name: Hellfire Greataxe
18.description: Hellfire Greataxe is a very rare greataxe that deals additional |Fire damage, afflicts its wielder with Heat on each successful hit, and grants the Hellflame Cleave weapon action.
18.quote: Anything hit by this has the life expectancy of a glass hammer.

effects.name: Thermodynamo
effects.description: Whenever you deal damage with this weapon, you gain 2 turns of Heat (Per attack).

18.name: Sethan
18.description: Sethan is a very rare greataxe that grants its wielder the Sethan: Spiritual Greataxe and Sethan: Reduce weapon actions.
18.quote: When this axe careens through the air towards an unfortunate head - the whistle of its spiritual counterpart is never far behind.

effects.name: Sethan: Spiritual Greataxe|w=40
effects.description: Summon a spiritual twin of Sethan in a point you can see, dealing  3d8 + spellcasting modifier | ForceVerify damage on a hit (Long rest).

effects.name: Sethan: Reduce|w=40
effects.description: Make a creature smaller. Its weapons deal d4|Physical 1d4 less damage (minimum of 1 damage). It has Disadvantage on Strength Ability Checks and SavingThrows (Long rest).

18.name: The Undead Bane
18.description: The Undead Bane is an uncommon greataxe that deals additional |Slashing damage against Fiends and Undead and grants its wielder the Profane Scourge weapon action.
18.quote: Wielded by the indomitable Ser Lexia. Although her eagerness to destroy evil in all its forms was constant, she often took time to make little gifts for her friends.

effects.name: Slay the Wicked
effects.description: This weapon deals an additional 1d6|Slashing damage against Fiends and Undead.

18.name: Very Heavy Greataxe
18.description: Very Heavy Greataxe is an uncommon greataxe that grants its wielder the Gargantuan Cleave weapon action.

19.name: Argument Solver
19.quote: Few things solve a disagreement faster than displaying a greatclub. And this one reeks, too.

19.name: Gnarled Tree Branch
19.description: Gnarled Tree Branch is a greatclub used by some ogres. It can only be obtained by disarming opponents and cannot be wielded by player characters.
19.quote: A heavy branch ripped from the trunk of an oak tree.

effects.name: Anonymous Effect
effects.description: Grants Tenacity: When you miss an attack, you deal 3 Bludgeoning damage anyway.

effects.name: Gnarled Tree Branch
effects.description: Grants Tenacity: When you miss an attack, you deal 3 Bludgeoning damage anyway.

19.name: Greatclub
19.quote: Traces of dried viscera ring many of the iron spikes embedded in this oak club.

19.name: Greatclub +1
19.quote: Without the wrapped leather grip, the weight of the slab of iron at the end of this greatclub would send it flying with a single swing.

19.name: Heavy Spiked Club
19.quote: Rusted iron spikes and mismatched stones are haphazardly lashed to the end of this thick oak branch.

19.name: Punch-Drunk Bastard
19.quote: You see... *hic* the thing... the really, really important thing *hic*... about this item is *belches copiously*... oh sod it, it's a club. Enjoy.

effects.name: Tippler's Rage
effects.description: When you have the Alcohol condition, you have Advantage on Attack Rolls. You also create a blast with each attack, dealing 1d4|Thunder damage for 3m / 10ft.

19.name: Rat Bat
19.description: The Rat Bat is a rare greatclub that grants the wielder advantage on their Attack Rolls against beasts.
19.quote: A club with nails hammered through it. Classic.

effects.name: Rat Catcher
effects.description: Attack Rolls against beasts have Advantage.

20.name: Balduran's Giantslayer
20.description: Balduran's Giantslayer is a legendary greatsword that receives doubled damage bonus from Strength and grants special bonuses against Large, Huge, and Gargantuan creatures.
20.quote: Wielded by Balduran, the founder of Baldur's Gate and friend to his guardian dragon, a great glittering wyrm called Ansur. Fellowship can be undone, though, as easily as you or I might unlace the strings of our shoes, and it was in a time of skullduggery and hardship that Balduran killed Ansur, carrying out the deed with this sword.

effects.name: Giantslayer
effects.description: On a hit, double the damage from your modifier. This weapon grants you advantage on attack rolls against Large, Huge or Gargantuan creatures.

effects.name: Giant Form|w=40
effects.description: Grow to a fearsome size. Your weapons deal an additional d6|Physical 1d6 damage and you gain 27 and advantage on Strength ability checks and saving throws (short rest).

20.name: Everburn Blade
20.description: Everburn Blade is an uncommon greatsword that deals additional |Fire damage.
20.quote: Silent flames surge the length of the blade as soon as it clears the scabbard.

20.name: Githyanki Greatsword
20.description: Githyanki Greatsword is an uncommon greatsword that deals additional |Psychic damage when wielded by a githyanki.
20.quote: Though heavily decorated and inlaid with rubies, the blade's sharp edge suggests its use isn't merely ornamental.

effects.name: Githborn Psionic Weapon
effects.description: When wielded by a githyanki this weapon deals an additional 1d4|Psychic damage.

20.name: Greatsword
20.description: Greatsword is a common variant of the Greatswords family of weapons.
20.quote: This sword's guard, held haphazardly in place by thin rope, wobbles slightly when swung.

20.name: Greatsword +1
20.description: Greatsword +1 is an uncommon, lightly enchanted greatsword.
20.quote: The thick leather straps wrapped around the base of the blade creak under a solid grip.

20.name: Jorgoral's Greatsword
20.description: Jorgoral's Greatsword is a rare greatsword that grants its wielder the Colossal Onslaught weapon action.
20.quote: Strong castle-forged steel surmounts a grip of sturdy leather - this immense sword is capable of disembowelling giants in a single swipe.

20.name: Reinforced Greatsword
20.description: Reinforced Greatsword is a common variant of the Greatswords family of weapons.
20.quote: This cumberstone blade looks strong enough to survive journey through all nine Hells.

20.name: Rusty Greatsword
20.description: Rusty Greatsword is a common variant of the Greatswords family of weapons.
20.quote: Large and crusted with rust, and about as useful as a drink of water to a drowning man.

20.name: Silver Sword of the Astral Plane
20.description: Silver Sword of the Astral Plane is a legendary greatsword that grants special bonuses when wielded by a githyanki.
20.quote: The fervour with which the githyanki express devotion to their queen is admirable to some, disquieting to others. When confronted with the fallibility of the divine (since no one is wholly perfect), who knows what reactions such folk might evince.

effects.name: Githborn Psionic Weapon
effects.description: When wielded by a githyanki this weapon deals an additional 1d6|Psychic damage.

effects.name: Githborn Psionic Resistance
effects.description: A githyanki holding this weapon has advantage on Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charismas, resistance to |Psychic damage, and cannot be Charmed.

20.name: Soulbreaker Greatsword
20.description: Soulbreaker Greatsword is a rare greatsword that grants a bonus to |Psychic}} damage when wielded by a [[githyanki.
20.quote: The sharp metal whispers to you. Pleading. Cursing... Echoes of slain foes.

effects.name: Githborn Psionic Weapon
effects.description: When wielded by a githyanki this weapon deals an additional 1d4|Psychic damage.

effects.name: Seldom Caught Unawares
effects.description: You gain a +2 bonus to Initiative rolls.

20.name: Sussur Greatsword
20.description: Sussur Greatsword is a rare greatsword that can Silenced|Silence targets on a successful hit.
20.quote: Sussur roots extend from this sword's hilt into the blade itself. It yearns to drink magic, silencing every creature it strikes.

effects.name: Anonymous Effect
effects.description: Silenced|Silences targets on hit.

effects.name: Sussur Greatsword
effects.description: Silenced|Silences targets on hit.

20.name: Svartlebee's Woundseeker
20.description: Svartlebee's Woundseeker is an uncommon greatsword that grants its wielder bonus to Attack Rolls against already damaged creatures.
20.quote: Wielded by Svartlebee The Custodian, so named because he had the following reputation: Have you got someone in your life causing a mess? Send Svartlebee a missive. He shall clean them up, and then clean up the crime scene.

effects.name: Deepen The Wound
effects.description: The wielder gains a d4|Physical +1d4 bonus to Attack Rolls with this weapon when attacking creatures that have already taken damage.

20.name: Sword of Chaos
20.description: Sword of Chaos is a very rare greatsword that deals additional |Necrotic damage and regains wielder's health on each successful hit.
20.quote: The sword of Sarevok, brother of Gorion's Ward and child of the evil god Bhaal. Though much of its power died with him, the sword is still formidable, and glows with a malevolent light.

effects.name: Chaos
effects.description: On a hit, regain 1d6|Healing.

20.name: Sword of Justice
20.description: Sword of Justice is an uncommon greatsword that grants its wielder the Tyr's Protection weapon action.
20.quote: The words 'Deliverance. Justice. Vengeance.' are engraved on the base of this sword. They echo in your mind.

effects.name: Tyr's Protection|w=40
effects.description: Surround a creature with a shimmering field of magic that increases its ArmourClass by 2. Spell ends when the Sword of Justice is unequipped (short rest).

20.name: Watcher Greatsword
20.description: Watcher Greatsword is a common greatsword. It can only be used by Steel Watchers.

21.name: Halberd
21.description: Halberd is a common variant of the Halberds family of weapons.
21.quote: Part of the spike affixed to the top of this halberd has snapped off, leaving a cruel barb.

21.name: Halberd +1
21.description: Halberd +1 is an uncommon, lightly enchanted halberd.
21.quote: This halberd's spike is black with ash that cannot be washed away.

21.name: Halberd of Vigilance
21.description: Halberd of Vigilance is a very rare halberd that deals additional |Force damage, gives bonus to Initiative, and grants Advantage on Perception checks and Reactions.
21.quote: A variant of this halberd's design was thrown out in the early stages of development by its forgemaster. This was because the halberd kept expressing itself. 'ALARM!' it would shriek in peril. 'POTENCY FILLS ME LIKE A SONG OF HOPE!' it roared in triumph.

effects.name: Sentinel Weapon
effects.description: Gain a +1 bonus to Initiative rolls and Advantage on Perception Ability Checks.

effects.name: Adroit Reflexes
effects.description: When you make an Attack Roll as a Reaction, you make it with Advantage.

21.name: Harmonium Halberd
21.description: Harmonium Halberd is a rare halberd that grants its wielder additional Strength at the cost of some Intelligence and Wisdom.
21.quote: The platinum inlays of this halberd hum an otherworldy harmony in the key of C, heightening the wielder's vigour but diminishing their mental faculties. The sound it makes is pining, as if far from its rightful home.

effects.name: Anonymous Effect
effects.description: Strength +2 (up to 23)

effects.name: Anonymous Effect
effects.description: Intelligence -1

effects.name: Anonymous Effect
effects.description: Wisdom -1

effects.name: Harmonium Halberd
effects.description:
Strength +2 (up to 23)
Intelligence -1
Wisdom -1

21.name: Hellbeard Halberd
21.description: Hellbeard Halberd is a rare halberd that deals additional |Poison damage.
21.quote: Salvaged from the beard of a dead infernal leviathan, whose facial hair was formed from the weapons of an army it had once vanquished.

21.name: Light of Creation
21.description: Light of Creation is an uncommon halberd that deals additional Lightning damage, but has a chance to Stunned|Stun its wielder on each successful attack.
21.quote: Small lodestones have been inserted along the halberd's shaft, a strange blue current running through them.

effects.name: Overcharge
effects.description: Chance to Stunned|Stun the wielderNotes, unless it is a Construct.

21.name: Merregon Halberd
21.description: Merregon Halberd is an uncommon, lightly enchanted halberd.
21.quote: Sharp teeth grow out of the halberd's dark metal - if it is indeed metal at all.

21.name: The Skinburster
21.description: The Skinburster is an uncommon halberd that grants its wielder Force Conduit on each successful hit.
21.quote: In mellow light, the halberd's curved steel head eerily resembles a grin.

effects.name: Skinburster Force
effects.description: When the wielder deals melee damage with this weapon, they gain 2 turns of Force Conduit.

22.name: Comeback Handaxe
22.quote: This loyal axe always returns to its owner after being thrown. However, it has no eyes and therefore dreadful aim, inevitably returning to its thrower blade-end-first.

22.name: Dad's Axe
22.quote: An old woodcutter's axe, infused with a shadow's bleak curse.

22.name: Dragon's Grasp
22.quote: Somehow, this axe is perpetually feels warm to the touch.

effects.name: Burned Alive
effects.description: Deals an additional 1d4|Slashing damage to Burning targets.

22.name: Handaxe
22.quote: A straightforward hatchet, dulled slightly from wood - or bones.

22.name: Handaxe +1
22.quote: This axe's hooked blade is crafted to cleave flesh and bone.

22.name: Ritual Axe
22.description: Ritual Axe is an uncommon Handaxe that inflicts Bane against the wielder's targets.
22.quote: Though shiny and recently polished, dried blood still fills the deepest crevices of this axe.

effects.name: The Scourge Mistress' Bane
effects.description: Chance to inflict a 1d4 penalty to Attack Rolls and Saving Throws on target. If the attacker still has 25% or more Hit Points, they take 1d6|Piercing damage themselves.

23.name: Firestoker
23.description: The Firestoker is an uncommon Hand Crossbow that deals additional damage to Burning targets.
23.quote: Though the crossbow's bolts look burning hot, they are pleasantly warm to the touch.

effects.name: Burned Alive
effects.description: Deals an additional 1d4|Piercing damage to Burning targets.

23.name: Hand Crossbow
23.quote: The spring locks back with the tiniest, most satisfying click.

23.name: Hand Crossbow +1
23.quote: A subtle magic runs through both strings of this crossbow, keeping the bows even once the lack is released.

23.name: Hand Crossbow +2
23.quote: Though the crossbow is small and light, a heavy power runs through its bowstring.

23.name: Hellfire Hand Crossbow
23.description: Hellfire Hand Crossbow is a very rare +2 Hand Crossbow that has a chance to inflict Burning when attacking while Hiding or Invisible. The wielder can also cast Scorching Ray as a 3rd level spell once per Short Rest.
23.quote: Rigged to draw on the skin-peeling hellfire of Avernus by a resourceful devil, this crossbow's size is no indication of its deadly potential.

effects.name: Hellstalker
effects.description: Possibly inflict Burning when attacking while Hiding or Invisible.

effects.name: Scorching Ray|w=40
effects.description: Can cast at Level 3 once per Short Rest.

23.name: Ne'er Misser
23.description: The Ne'er Misser is an uncommon Hand Crossbow that deals Force damage on its attacks and grants the wearer the ability to cast Spell.
23.quote: On the stock, the crafter of this crossbow etched in tiny print: 'Ifn yer gonna miss, why dontchyae stop being a wally, and hit instead!'

effects.name: Magic Missile|w=40
effects.description: Cast the spell at Level 3 once per Short Rest.

24.name: Crossbow of Arcane Force
24.icon: Crossbow of Arcane Force Unfaded Icon.png
24.description: Crossbow of Arcane Force is an uncommon, lightly enchanted (+1) Heavy Crossbow that grants the wielder a special Arcane Ammunition weapon action.
24.quote: The soft hum of power emanates from the allien metal.

24.name: Fabricated Arbalest
24.quote: A perfect system must be ruled by a keen eye - and any error foolish enough to rear its head afore the eye must be quickly, precisely, and totally eliminated. This crossbow can help with that.

24.name: Gandrel's Aspiration
24.quote: When Gandrel was seven, he was frightened badly by a vampire spawn during a public burning. Seized by the flames, the creature didn't shrivel up. It swelled and burst.

effects.name: Feller of Monsters
effects.description: You have Advantage against Monstrosity type enemies.

24.name: Giantbreaker
24.quote: Legends say the Giantbreaker earned its name when an elven ranger singlehandedly defeated a score of hill giants. While the ranger's name is long forgotten, Giantbreaker's lives on.

effects.name: Heavy Hitter
effects.description: Your weapon hits hard enough to send your target Reeling for 2 turns.

24.name: Githyanki Crossbow
24.quote: This heavy crossbow is fashioned from a curious, tensile metal that doesn't seem to be native to Faerûn.

24.name: Harold
24.quote: Named after Harold Butterbisk, who opened the Butterbisk Inn in Waterdeep before it was renamed by new owners. The stock of the crossbow reads: Quaffing is a shootable offence.

effects.name: Haroldish Doom
effects.description: When you deal damage to a target with a ranged weapon, it must succeed a Charisma CHA|dc=13 or be  size=25|Bane Icon|Bane (Condition)|Baned for 2 turns.

24.name: Heavy Crossbow
24.quote: A standard-issue crossbow, used by many guardsmen.

24.name: Heavy Crossbow +1
24.quote: Despite the heaviness of this crossbow, the latch pulls back with an effortless ease.

24.name: Hellfire Engine Crossbow
24.quote: 'Trundling, mashing, mincing, crushing, grinding, blasting, biting! Hear their peeling thunder, their roaring flames, their clicking, whirring, metallic melody, and know that the hellfire engines of Avernus are on the move!' - Edict in Elturel

effects.name: Lightning Arrow|w=40
effects.description: Can cast at Level 4, once per Long Rest.

24.name: The Long Arm of the Gur
24.quote:
When the boy was seven, he was frightened badly by a vampire spawn during a public burning. Seized by the flames, the creature didn't shrivel up. It swelled and burst like a squeezed leech. Brains splattered the boy's shoes, grey-pink and pulpy.

He would never forget it.

effects.name: Revenant Scourge
effects.description: When used against undead creatures this weapon as +1d4 bonus to Attack and Damage rolls.

25.name: BOOOAL's Arms
25.quote: The cut-off pincer of some Underdark crustacean seems to magically adhere to a bone shaft, creating a make-shift javelin.

25.name: Javelin
25.quote: A rusted fishing harpoon, repurposed as a weapon.

25.name: Javelin +1
25.quote: A rusted fishing harpoon, repurposed as a weapon.

26.name: Light Crossbow
26.quote: This crossbow’s cast iron latch is mottled with blooms of rust.

26.name: Light Crossbow +1
26.quote: Though this crossbow's stock is hollowed out, its heavy trigger mechanism keeps it well balanced.

26.name: Sharran Crossbow
26.description: Sharran Crossbow is an uncommon Light Crosbow, identical to a Light Crossbow +1 aside from the flavour text.
26.quote: A sleek, well-made crossbow that is plain but for the symbol of Shar on the handle.

27.name: Light Hammer
27.quote: A blacksmith's pride and joy, repurposed for combat.  Its steel head is tarnished from years in the forge.

27.name: Light Hammer +1
27.quote: A skillful smith decorated the wooden handle with a fine golden filigree.

27.name: Shining Staver-of-Skulls
27.quote: Look no further than Scyllua Darkhope - fallen paladin and champion of Bane - to see how the tools of good can be turned to evil purpose.

27.name: Skybreaker
27.icon: Light Hammer B PlusOne Unfaded Icon.png
27.quote: "And they shall have Celestia's light, even if we must crack wide the heavens to bring it."

effects.name: Searing Smite|w=40
effects.description: Can cast once per Long Rest

27.name: Wulbren's Hammer
27.quote: "Constructs and objects melt beneath this hefty blunt tool when wielded by a sharp mind."

28.name: Gontr Mael
28.description: Gontr Mael is a legendary Longbow that can possibly inflict Guiding Bolt on its target and grants the Celestial Haste and Bolt of Celestial Light actions.
28.quote: Gontr Mael blasted from the corpse of the Steelwatcher Titan: a bow formed from the boiling slag and weird whispering gyros inherent to the mechanical giant. It must have acted as the Titan's abdomen, exchanging muscle for immaculate steel.

effects.name: Promised Victory
effects.description: On a hit, possibly inflict Guiding Bolt (DEX|dc=15) upon the target.

effects.name: Gontr Mael: Glowing|w=40
effects.description: This object shines with a glowing light in a radius of 6m.

effects.name: Celestial Haste|w=40
effects.description: Cast as a level 3 spell (Long Rest).

28.name: Hellrider Longbow
28.quote: This longbow was forged from the remnants of Stanislav the Silver's shield, found near the wreckage of Castle Ravenloft some years ago.

effects.name: Heightened Awareness
effects.description: Gain a +3 bonus to Ability Checks.

effects.name: Fiendish Fire
effects.description: Once per turn, a creature hit by this weapon will possibly be afflicted with Faerie Fire DEX|dc=13 to negate.

28.name: Longbow
28.quote: During the Crown Wars, the demand for longbows was such that adult yew trees were almost driven to extinction.

28.name: Longbow +1
28.quote: Carved enchantments span the length of this supple bow.

28.name: Spellthief
28.quote: A shiver of magic flows from this bow into your hand - like a promise.

effects.name: Arcane Vehemence
effects.description: Once per Critical hit with the Spellthief.

28.name: The Dead Shot
28.quote: When the archer Frederik Durlusk died, his only request was to be buried with his favorite bow. This is that bow.

effects.name: Improved Critical
effects.description: The number you need to roll a Critical Hit while attacking is reduced by 1. This effect can stack.

effects.name: Keen Attack
effects.description: The wielder doubles their Proficiency Bonus when rolling ranged attacks with this weapon, unless they have Disadvantage.

28.name: The Joltshooter
28.description: The Joltshooter is a rare Longbow that allows the wielder to generate Lightning Charges upon dealing damage with this weapon.
28.quote: Sleek and lightweight, it is said that the Joltshooter was Yrre the Sparkstruck's favourite weapon. They were indifferent towards bows, but the spikes jutting out of it?

effects.name: Electric Blood
effects.description: When the wielder deals damage with this weapon, they gain 2 Lightning Charges.

28.name: Titanstring Bow
28.description: Titanstring Bow is a rare +1 Longbow that allows its wielder to add their Strength Modifier to damage dealt with this weapon.
28.quote: The commonly held belief that archers are rangey, thin-wristed people is completely false. It takes years of training to pull a bowstring all the way back to your cheekbone, and wrists like iron.

effects.name: Titan Weapon
effects.description: This weapon deals additional damage equal to your Strength Modifier.

29.name: Adamantine Longsword
29.quote: Though heavy, this longsword swings effortlessly in your hand -- ready to take down a hundred enemies.

effects.name: Diamondsbane
effects.description: If an adamantine weapon hits an object, the hit is always critical.

effects.name: Lethal Weapon
effects.description: This weapon ignores Resistance to Slashing damage.

29.name: Battle-Worn Blade
29.quote: A fine but well-used sword. It seemed to have once belonged to a holy order, but the indication of rank and patron deity at the hilt have recently been filed down.

29.name: Blackguard's Sword
29.quote: Formerly wielded by one who forsook all ties of friendship and kindness, this sword is rife with deranged energies. It seems to transmit feelings of contentment when carving through bones.

effects.name: Dazing Smite
effects.description: On a hit infused with one of your Smites, the target must succeed a Constitution SavingThrow or become Dazed Condition Icon|Dazed (Condition)|Dazed.

29.name: Blade of Oppressed Souls
29.quote: Fragments of dead souls are imprisoned in the steel. Angry, powerful, hopeful, or scared - all of them rose up against their illithid masters, and all of them fell to this blade. Now, they are trapped forever, forced to aid their opressors.

29.name: Bonesaw
29.quote: The saw's teeth are blunt and rusted, it's beautiful metalwork barely visible beneath a layer of black, coagulated blood.

29.name: Ceremonial Longsword
29.description: Ceremonial Longsword is an uncommon, lightly enchanted longsword. It is used to solve the Dawnmaster's Crest puzzle in the Rosymorn Monastery.
29.quote: A complex filigree wraps around the base of this blade - the runes on the side suggesting it is not merely decorative.

29.name: Cruel Sting
29.quote: The trauma of becoming a drider is quickly set aside with a cold arachnid dispassion. This sword follows that disturbing trend - a replenishing poison gland is built within, deployed only against trapped opponents.

effects.name: Sting The Helpless
effects.description: A drow elf wielding this weapon deals an additional  1d4 | Poison damage against Restrained targets

effects.name: Anonymous Effect
effects.description: Ensnaring Strands|w=40

effects.name: Cruel Sting
effects.description: Ensnaring Strands|w=40

29.name: Duke Ravengard's Longsword
29.quote: Cradling his newborn son awkwardly, the Duke's face pulled into a rictus of misery. His love Francesca smiled at him, briefly, and died. He stared at her until the boy cried, and he told the boy it would be all right, though he himself did not believe it.

effects.name: Stirring Execution
effects.description: When you kill an enemy, allies within 9m / 30ft gain Temporary Hit Points equal to your Charisma Modifier (minimum 1).

effects.name: Commander's Strike|w=40
effects.description: Direct an ally to strike a foe. The ally uses a Reaction on their next turn to make a weapon attack. Once per Short Rest.

29.name: Githyanki Longsword
29.quote: Every tip and edge on this elaborate sword is sharpened to a deadly perfection.

29.name: Katana
29.quote: The hilt of this slender sword is wrapped with soft, black silk — the dark colour hiding any possible stains.

29.name: King's Knife
29.description: King's Knife is a Duergar variant of the common Longsword. It is identical to a Longsword in all but appearance.
29.quote: Crudely forged with mismatched components, nearly rusted through, and plenty sharp.

29.name: Larethian's Wrath
29.quote: Deceptively light, the blade rasps through castle-forged plate as easily as Corellon Larethian's own anarchic holy sword through the hearts of evil orcs.

29.name: Longsword
29.quote: A common sword, passed between hands both fresh and battle-scarred.

29.name: Longsword +1
29.quote: A complex filigree wraps around the base of this blade - the runes on the side suggesting it is not merely decorative.

29.name: Phalar Aluve
29.quote: The drow inscription on this blade appears to have been recently carved. It translates to: 'Though I have to leave you, I will dance forever in Eilistraee's Light.'

effects.name: Phalar Aluve: Melody|w=40
effects.description: The sword hums in anticipation, ready to Phalar Aluve: Sing|Sing or Phalar Aluve: Shriek|Shriek. Effect ends when Phalar Aluve is unequipped.

effects.name: Anonymous Effect
effects.description: Performance +1

effects.name: Phalar Aluve
effects.description: Performance +1

29.name: Rusty Longsword
29.quote: Mottled with rust, this longsword is a hideous excuse for a blade.

29.name: Sword of the Emperor
29.quote: There's a graceful swarthiness to this sword. The inscription in the steel reads - 'My eye wanders far from home / To shores of distant Anchorome.'

effects.name: Shapeshifter Slayer
effects.description: This weapon deals an additional 1d4 damage against shapeshifters or polymorphed creatures.

effects.name: Magical Durability
effects.description: The wielder has a +2 bonus to Saving Throws against spells.

29.name: Voss' Silver Sword
29.description: Voss' Silver Sword is a very rare, moderately enchanted (+2) Longsword enhanced with additional Psychic damage. Also, grants a bonus to damage and Attack Rolls againts githytanki, aberrations, fiends and elementals and grants the wearer the ability to cast Wrathful Smite spell.
29.quote: Heavy and grouted in the gore of countless centuries, this prototype for the contemporary githyanki silver sword was wielded during their rebellion against the mind flayers who enslaved them.

effects.name: Interplanar Slayer
effects.description: This weapon grants a d4|Physical 1d4 bonus to Damage and Attack Rolls against githyanki, aberrations, fiends, and elementals.

effects.name: Wrathful Smite|w=40
effects.description: Cast the spell Wrathful Smite once per Long Rest.

30.name: Adamantine Mace
30.quote: A nimble mace, heavy with the promise of broken bones.

effects.name: Diamondsbane
effects.description: If an adamantine weapon hits an object, the hit is always critical.

effects.name: Lethal Weapon
effects.description: This weapon ignores Resistance to Bludgeoning damage.

30.name: Ceremonial Mace
30.quote: The leather handle of this mace smells badly of rotting blood.

30.name: Deva Mace
30.description: Deva Mace is a common variant of the Maces family of weapons wielded by Deva.
30.quote: The golden slopes of the celestial heavens are filled with angels. Theistic scholars don't know what they do, but whatever it is, they do it holy.

30.name: Devotee's Mace
30.quote: This weapon is favoured by celestial devas, the vanguards of the divine ranks of paradise.

effects.name: Healing Incense Aura Icon|Healing Incense Aura (Class Action)|Healing Incense Aura (Main Hand Only)
effects.description: Once per Long Rest, Emanate a soothing aura. You and nearby allies regain 1d4|Healing at the start of your turn. (10 turns) Healing Incense Aura|item

30.name: Handmaiden's Mace
30.quote: This mace was designed by Lolth's assassins to fell heretics who dared turn their back on the Spider Queen. However, even the best-laid designs fall to nothingness when brought to bear against Shar's faithfull.

30.name: Infernal Mace
30.description: Infernal Mace is a rare +2 Mace that deals an additional Poison|3 Poison Damage on hit and has a chance to Poisoned|Poison targets it strikes.
30.quote: Precise infernal runes are woven into this weapon's filigree, implying a creator well-versed in hellish arcana.

effects.name: Infernal Weapon
effects.description: On a hit, the affected entity deals an additional 3|Poison damage and can possibly Poisoned|Poison its target.

30.name: Loviatar's Scourge
30.description: Loviatar's Scourge is an uncommon Mace that deals additional Necrotic damage to all nearby creatures, including the wielder.
30.quote: More club than scourge, this weapon has a serrated edge made for drawing long, shallow cuts.

effects.name: Willing Whip
effects.description: Grants Resistance to Necrotic damage. Deals an additional 1d6|Necrotic damage to nearby targets, including the wielder.

effects.name: Anonymous Effect
effects.description: Due to the Resistance granted by the weapon, the wielder takes only 1~3|Necrotic damage. However, nearby allies take full damage.

effects.name: Loviatar's Scourge
effects.description: Due to the Resistance granted by the weapon, the wielder takes only 1~3|Necrotic damage. However, nearby allies take full damage.

30.name: Mace
30.quote: A simple but effective mace, cast en masse by human blacksmiths.

30.name: Mace +1
30.quote: The leather handle of this mace smells badly of rotting blood.

30.name: Rusty Mace
30.quote: The head of this mace is a scratchboard of peeling orange rust.

30.name: Shattered Flail
30.description: Shattered Flail is a rare Mace with a +2 Enchantment that heals the wielder when they hit an enemy - at the cost of potentially going mad when they stop attacking.
30.quote: A bundle of bones and blood - and a soul-piercing demonic presence - is all that remains of the Flind's flail. It would make a decent mace with a particularly nasty bite.

effects.name: Yeenoghu's Gift
effects.description: Hitting an enemy with this weapon heals the wielder for 1d6|Healing - but they can go Mad if they don't continue hitting an enemy each turn.

30.name: The Blood of Lathander
30.icon: The Blood of Lathander Unfaded Icon.png
30.description: The Blood of Lathander is a legendary +3 Mace found through the Find the Blood of Lathander quest. It continuously sheds light, blinds nearby Fiends and Undead with its light, can heal its wielder, and allows the wielder to cast Sunbeam.

effects.name: Lathander's Blessing
effects.description: Once per Long Rest, when your hit points are reduced to 0, you regain 2~12 hit points. Allies within 9m also regain 1~6 hit points.

effects.name: Lathander's Light
effects.description: Sheds holy light in a 6m radius. In combat, fiends and undead standing in the light are Blinded. Notes

effects.name: Sunbeam|w=40
effects.description: Can cast once per Long Rest.

effects.name: Anonymous Effect
effects.description: Lathander's Light: Sheds holy light in a 6m radius. In combat, fiends and undead standing in the light are Blinded. Notes

effects.name: The Blood of Lathander
effects.description: Lathander's Light: Sheds holy light in a 6m radius. In combat, fiends and undead standing in the light are Blinded. Notes

30.name: Xyanyde
30.quote: Cast deep in the Underdark by duergar slaves, the head of this mace is engraved with spiderwebs. It is ice-cold to the touch.

effects.name: Xyanyde's Fire
effects.description: Once per Short Rest, you can encase a target in Faerie Fire for 2 turns if you miss an attack against it.

31.name: Corpsegrinder
31.description: Corpsegrinder is a rare maul that deals additional |Thunder damage and grants its wielder the Grand Slam weapon action.
31.quote: Reliable and trustworthy, you could not hope for more respectable company than this maul whilst traversing the forlorn places of the world.

31.name: Doom Hammer
31.description: Doom Hammer is an uncommon maul that afflicts targets with Bone Chilled condition on each successful hit.
31.quote: Bringer of that which it is.

effects.name: Edge of Terror
effects.description: Each strike fills the target with a chilling dread that prevents it from regaining Hp. Undead creatures also get Disadvantage on Attack Rolls.

31.name: Foebreaker
31.description: Foebreaker is a very rare maul that ignores Bludgeoning resistance of targets.
31.quote: As heavy and opposed to nonsense as the wearied hammer of a sentencing magistrate.

effects.name: Lethal Weapon
effects.description: This weapon ignores Bludgeoning resistance.

31.name: Hamarhraft
31.description: Hamarhraft is an uncommon maul that deals Thunder damage in an area around the wielder when they land a Jump (Bonus Action)|Jump.
31.quote: The Dwarven grammar is garbled, but the weapon's name suggests something about the importance of first impressions.

effects.name: Shockwave
effects.description: When the wearer Jump (Bonus Action)|Jumps, they deal 1d4|Thunder damage in a 3 m / 10 ft radius upon landing.

31.name: Maul
31.description: Maul is a common variant of the Mauls family of weapons.
31.quote: Hammers like this are used in many dwarven competitions, testing who can throw them the farthest while enduring the most ale.

31.name: Maul +1
31.description: Maul +1 is an uncommon, lightly enchanted maul.
31.quote: A weapon of dwarven make: elegant, but strong enough to last several human lifetimes.

32.name: Morningstar
32.quote:
●More of this morningstar's iron spikes are bent than not.


●A tuft of hair is caked to the base of one of this morningstar's jagged spiked.

32.name: Morningstar +1
32.quote: It's said that one warrior with a morningstar is worth seventeen with a sword - one for each of the weapon's spikes.

32.name: Ravengard's Scourger
32.quote: Duke Ravengard's father was the sort of man who works with his hands, and communicates in grunts. In his heart his son vowed to do better. But when Wyll was born, Ravengard felt a strange gravity that drew him away from his son.

effects.name: Commander's Strike|w=40
effects.description: Direct an ally to strike a foe. The ally uses a reaction on their next turn to make a weapon attack. Once per Short Rest.

32.name: The Sacred Star
32.quote: The power of this item lies in belief, though not in any god. This item believes that it's very good at hitting things, so it is. Belief is quite powerful when it comes to violence.

effects.name: Radiant Strike
effects.description: On a hit, inflict 1 turn of Radiating Orb upon the target.

effects.name: Sanctified Weapon
effects.description: Undead creatures struck by this weapon are possibly Turned.

effects.name: Tenacity
effects.description: (Main Hand Only) When you miss an attack, you deal 1 Bludgeoning damage anyway.

32.name: Twist of Fortune
32.description: Twist of Fortune is a rare +1 Morningstar with the unique weapon action, Blood Money. When the wielder rolls 2 or less with with this weapon's damage die, they reroll and take the new result.
32.quote: They say rich folk are never truly happy; especially true when they're targeted with this morningstar.

effects.name: Twist of Fortune
effects.description: When you roll 2 or less with this weapon's damage die, reroll it and take the new result.

33.name: Breaching Pikestaff
33.quote: Concussive energy thumps like a mighty heartbeat from this pike.

33.name: Pike
33.quote: This pike's broad steel head has been repeatedly bent and hammered back into its original shape.

33.name: Pike +1
33.quote: The base of this polearm's shaft is splintered, likely having borne the weight of a rider plucked from their mount.

33.name: Returning Pike
33.quote: A 'Crazy Wilbur' is a technique invented by the dwarvish Ticklebeard Clan. It involves getting your larger enemies to swallow your weapon, then calling it back to you - as messily as possible.

effects.name: Homing Weapon
effects.description: This weapon will return to its owner when thrown.

33.name: Unseen Menace
33.description: Unseen Menace is a rare, lightly enchanted (+1) Pike that allows gaining advantage and connecting critical hits more easily.
33.quote: Yes, but what exactly is hitting you?

effects.name: Invisible Weapon
effects.description: This weapon is Invisible Weapon|Invisible while equipped. It loses this property for 2 rounds on a missed Attack Roll.

effects.name: Invisible
effects.description: Affected entity can't be disarmed. It has Advantage on Attack Rolls. It scores a Critical Hit when rolling a 19.

34.name: Bigboy's Chew Toy
34.description: Bigboy's Chew Toy is a rare +1 Quarterstaff that grants its wielder the ability the ability to cast Enlarge on themselves once per Long Rest.
34.quote: Often mistaken for a relic of the wizard Bigby's creation, this staff was, ironically, made as a bite stick for Bigby's dog, Bigboy.

effects.name: Whossa Large Fellow?|w=40
effects.description: Grow in size to become stronger (Long Rest).

34.name: Cacophony
34.quote: The fire engulfing this staff seems to feed off thin air, never once burning the dark wood.

effects.name: Thunderous Smite|w=40
effects.description: Cast the spell at Level 1, once per Short Rest

34.name: Caitiff Staff
34.quote: The texture of magic granted by a warlock's patron is largely dependent upon the patron themselves - for example, your standard eldritch patron's probably going to work some eyeball-mottled tentacles in there somewhere.

effects.name: Arcane Enchantments
effects.description: You gain a +1 bonus to Spell Save DC and Spell Attack Rolls.

effects.name: Caitiff's Restoration
effects.description: Once per Long Rest Replenish 1 expended Warlock spell slots.

34.name: Corellon's Grace
34.quote: This light, flexible staff is of elven make, marked with mithral sigils that channel magic in the blink of an eye.

effects.name: Natural Pugilist
effects.description: You gain a +1 bonus to Unarmed Attack Rolls and damage.

effects.name: Unhampered Resistance
effects.description: While the wielder is not wearing armour, they receive a +2 bonus to Saving Throws.

34.name: Creation's Echo
34.quote: This staff pulses with energy, swiftly attuning itself to the beat of your heart.

effects.name: Elemental Resonance
effects.description: If the wielder deals Acid, Fire, Lightning, Radiant, or Necrotic damage, it become resistant to that damage type for 2 turns.

34.name: Despair of Athkatla
34.quote: Touching the adornments, it's clear that Lorroakan's short temper has flowed into his staff. It flows into your brain in shades of burgundy and carmine, bright as the storm-lanterns of Lorroakan's homeland.

effects.name: Arcane Enchantment
effects.description: You gain a +1 bonus to Spell Save DC and Spell Attack Rolls.

34.name: Druid Quarterstaff
34.description: The Druid Quarterstaff is a visually different variant of the regular Quarterstaff.  The only change is in appearance; all actual attributes are exactly the same.  Custom characters of the Druid class start the game with this weapon.
34.quote: Someone has carved twenty-seven small lines into the hard wood.

34.name: Gold Wyrmling Staff
34.quote: The fire engulfing this staff seems to feed off thin air, never once burning the dark wood.

effects.name: Fire Bolt|w=40
effects.description: Cast the spell Fire Bolt

34.name: Harper Sacredstriker
34.quote: This quarterstaff is as solid as the bond between each member of the Harpers - even working in anonymity, they do so with a common and righteous cause.

effects.name: Spiritual Weapon|w=40
effects.description: Cast the spell at level 6 once per Long Rest.

34.name: Hollow's Staff
34.quote: This staff was wielded by Thibault Hollow, a supremely talented necromancer notable for his overwhelming fear of zombies. Many was the time when his dread lair would echo with a high-pitched shriek when one of them surprised him in a corridor, or when he was taking a bath.

effects.name: Heightened Necromancy
effects.description: Creatures have Disadvantage on SavingThrows against your Necromancy Spells.

effects.name: Arms of Hadar|w=40
effects.description: Cast the spell once per Long Rest.

34.name: Incandescent Staff
34.quote: Etchings course red-hot through the length of this staff, the script of primordial fire writ in flame.

effects.name: Fire Bolt|w=40
effects.description: Cast the Cantrip Fire Bolt

effects.name: Fireball|w=40
effects.description: Cast the spell at Level 3 once per Long Rest

effects.name: Anonymous Effect
effects.description: Ranged Spell Attack +1

effects.name: Anonymous Effect
effects.description: Resistance to Fire damage

effects.name: Incandescent Staff
effects.description:
Ranged Spell Attack +1
Resistance to Fire damage

34.name: Markoheshkir
34.quote: Kereska, draconic goddess of arcane knowledge, imbues many chromatic dragons with their magic. This includes their exquisite and terrible breath, which has wrenched giants from their tall thrones, and destroyed civilisations of smallfolk.

effects.name: Arcane Enchantment
effects.description: You gain a +1 bonus to Spell Save DC and Spell Attack Rolls.

effects.name: Arcane Battery|w=40
effects.description: Alleviate the arcane burden of spellcasting with the power of this staff. The next spell you cast doesn't cost a spell slot. Once per Long Rest.

34.name: Melf's First Staff
34.description: The Melf's First Staff is a variant of the Spell Save DC and Spell Attack Rolls, and allows the wearer to cast Melf's Acid Arrow.
34.quote: This light, flexible staff is of elven make, marked with mithral sigils that channel magic in the blink of an eye.

effects.name: Arcane Enchantment
effects.description: You gain a +1 bonus to Spell Save DC and Spell Attack Rolls.

effects.name: Melf's Acid Arrow|w=40
effects.description: Can cast once per Long Rest.

34.name: Mourning Frost
34.quote: The air around this staff crackles with a cold, frosty wind - a power that has been divided for too long, and is waiting to be released.

effects.name: Heart of Ice
effects.description: When dealing Cold|Cold damage, the wielder deals an additional 1|Cold damage. (if you inspect the ability, there also this description: 'A Frostbitten creature, that takes Cold damage will take an additional 1 Cold damage per turn of remaining Frostbite')

effects.name: Insidious Cold
effects.description: Dealing Cold|Cold damage with a spell possibly inflicts Chilled upon the target.

effects.name: Ray of Frost|w=40
effects.description: Wielder can cast the cantrip at will.

34.name: Nature's Snare
34.description: Nature's Snare is a variant of the Quarterstaves family of weapons that gives its wielder a chance to Ensnared|Ensnare non-plants and non-beasts on hit.
34.quote: Thread-like vines wriggle along this wooden staff.

effects.name: Fly Trap
effects.description: Chance to Ensnared|Ensnare target if it is not a plant or a beast. STR|dc=12.

34.name: Pale Oak
34.description: Pale Oak is a rare Quarterstaff obtainable only by Druids as a quest reward.
34.quote: Infused with Silvanus' strength, these staves are gifted to Faithwardens who act in defence of nature.

effects.name: Faithwarden's Stride
effects.description: Druidic vines cannot Ensnared|Ensnare you and do not count as Difficult Terrain.

effects.name: Faithwarden's Vines|w=40
effects.description: Vines sprout from the ground, slowing creatures within and possibly Entangled|Entangling them Long Rest.

34.name: Quarterstaff
34.quote: Someone has carved twenty-seven small lines into the hard wood.

34.name: Quarterstaff +1
34.quote: A polished wooden staff, embellished with knobs and steel for both function and design.

34.name: Quarterstaff +2
34.quote: Steel bands wrap around a wooden core, giving this staff extra momentum.

34.name: Rain Dancer
34.quote: A pale staff inlaid with a droplet-shaped topaz. It is cool to the touch.

effects.name: Create Water|w=40
effects.description: Can cast the spell once per Short Rest.

34.name: Ritual Staff
34.description:
The Ritual Staff is a mundane, nonmagical variant of the simple melee weapon that can be wielded in one hand, or with both hands for extra damage.

Beyond its unique appearance, this staff has the same stats of a normal Quarterstaff.
34.quote: Streaks of tendon and sinew cling to the animal skill lashed atop of this wooden staff.

34.name: Staff of Arcane Blessing
34.description: Staff of Arcane Blessing is a uncommon Quarterstaff that grants the wielder the ability to cast Bless. In addition, all Bless spells cast by the wielder grant an additional +1d4 to Spell Attack Rolls.
34.quote: Though dust has settled into every nook and cranny of this staff, it still emanates a soothing aura. Its previous owner cast it aside - forgotten because there was nobody to bless.

effects.name: Mystra's Blessing
effects.description: Bless grants an additional 1d4 to Saving Throws and Weapon Attack Rolls, and an additional 2d4 to Spell Attack Rolls.

effects.name: Bless|w=40
effects.description: Cast as a level 1 spell (Long Rest).

34.name: Staff of Cherished Necromancy
34.icon: Staff of Cherished Necromancy Unfaded Icon.png
34.quote: Unlike their father, Thibault, Cherish Hollow was not afraid of zombies. Cherish was afraid of sharks, liquorice, wallpaper, Netherese artifacts, hats (large), the outdoors, the indoors, hats (small), and milk pails.

effects.name: Heightened Necromancy
effects.description: Creatures have Disadvantage on Necromancy spells.

effects.name: Life Essence Harvest
effects.description: When the wielder kills a hostile creature with a spell, they greedily absorb its energy and gain Life Essence until their next Long Rest.

34.name: Staff of Crones
34.description: SpoilerWarning Staff of Crones is an uncommon variant of the Quarterstaves family of weapons as well as a Story Item.
34.quote: Live worms wriggle beneath the crumbling surface of this half-rotten staff. Merely touching it fills you with a wave of unbearable nausea and a strange longing, as if it's calling out for its like.

effects.name: Ray of Sickness|w=40
effects.description: Cast as a level 1 spell (Short Rest).

34.name: Staff of Interruption
34.description: Staff of Interruption is a rare quarterstaff that allows the wielder to cast Counterspell at Level 5
34.quote: This staff hums with a disruptive arcane energy that drives nearby spellcasters to distraction

effects.name: Counterspell|w=40
effects.description: Cast at level 5 once per Long Rest

34.name: Staff of Spell Power
34.description: Staff of Spell Power is a very rare Quarterstaff that can be obtained from the House of Hope.
34.quote: A near-perfect relic that is only blemished by the collected palm-sweat of various archmagi from across the Realms.

effects.name: Arcane Enchantment
effects.description: You gain a +1 bonus to Spell Save DC and Spell Attack Rolls.

effects.name: Arcane Battery|w=40
effects.description: Alleviate the arcane burden of spellcasting with the power of this staff. The next spell you cast doesn't cost a spell slot. Once per Long Rest.

superRegion.name: Other Locations and Planes of Existence

34.name: Staff of a Mumbling Wizard
34.description: Staff of a Mumbling Wizard is a visually different variant of the regular Quarterstaff.
34.quote: Because it was designed by a compulsive mumbler, this staff can't distinguish between its spells, and so can only cast - Fireball or Firebolt at random.

effects.name: Firebolt?|w=40
effects.description: Can cast the cantrip at will.

34.name: Staff of the Emperor
34.quote: Ceremorphosis eradicates great swathes of the conciousness that came before... but not everything. Touching the staff, a fragment of the Emperor's memory slithers into your brain - you see sea waves foaming into spume, and feel the explorer's exultant joy. Then the image is gone, like so much silken night under a cut-shade sun.

effects.name: Arcane Enchantment
effects.description: You gain a +1 bonus to Spell Save DC and Spell Attack Rolls.

effects.name: Imperial Retaliation
effects.description: When the wielder succeeds a Saving Throw, the foe that caused the throw needs to make an Intelligence Saving Throw or be Stunned for 1 turn.

34.name: Staff of the Moonmaiden
34.description: The Staff of the Moonmaiden is a mundane, nonmagical variant of the simple melee weapon that can be wielded in one hand, or with both hands for extra damage.
34.quote: This staff's blue inlays and moon-shaped ornamentation indicate its use among Selûne's clergy.

34.name: Staff of the Ram (Quarterstaff)
34.quote:
Fashioned by some unknown archmage - no identifying insignia is forthcoming.
The staff thrums with a slow, ferocious pulse that draws its concussive power from the spiral-horned creatures that gave the weapon its name

effects.name: Staff of the Ram
effects.description: Once per turn, the blow possibly knocks a foe back 2m, and Stunned|Stuns them CON|dc=8. This has no effect on dragons or Huge creatures.

34.name: The Spellsparkler
34.description: The Spellsparkler is a rare Quarterstaff that allows the wielder to generate Lightning Charges upon dealing damage with spells.
34.quote: Yrre the Sparkstruck intended to give the Spellsparkler to Lenore a cleric of Mystra and old lover. But when the gnome returned to the cleric's tower, they found it empty - inhabited only by dust and abandoned experiments.

effects.name: Electric Veins
effects.description: When the wielder deals damage with a spell or cantrip, they gain 2 Lightning Charges Condition Icon|Lightning Charges.

34.name: Twisted Oak Crook
34.quote: A staff engraved with a leafy motif, maples and oakleaf winding through a forest going through every stage of life, spring to bare-branched winter.

34.name: Woe
34.description: Woe is a very rare, moderately enchanted (+2) special variant of the Cazador Szarr. It grants better Spell Save DC and Blight}} spell, and healing when creatures fail [[Saving Throws by the caster's spells.
34.quote: The gentle tap-tap-tap of a staff on stone sparked terror for all in Cazador's palace. It signalled an approaching storm, and all they could do was shrink into the background and pray its wrath would not fall on them.

effects.name: Arcane Enchantment
effects.description: You gain a +1 bonus to Spell Save DC and Spell Attack Rolls.

effects.name: Arcane Vampirism
effects.description: When the creatures affected by your spells fail any associated Saving Throws regain 1d4.

effects.name: Anonymous Effect
effects.description: Can cast Blight at 4th level.

effects.name: Anonymous Effect
effects.description: Long Rest

effects.name: Woe
effects.description:
Can cast Blight at 4th level.
Long Rest

35.name: Duellist's Prerogative
35.quote: A blade gifted to Lora by her own mother, Lenore the Fleet. When challenged to duels, Lenore's opponents assumed she had received this nickname from some naval exploit. They found out how wrong they were when her blade blurred faster than the eye could follow.

effects.name: Elegant Duellist
effects.description: While your off-hand is empty, you score a reaction per turn.

effects.name: Withering Cut
effects.description: On a hit with a melee weapon, use a reaction to deal additional Necrotic damage equal to your Proficiency Bonus.

effects.name: Challenge to Duel|w=40
effects.description: Cast as a level 1 spell.

35.name: Harmonic Dueller
35.quote: Unsheathed, the steel of this rapier shivers and thrums mellifluously in response to nearby surfaces - the motion brings to mind an actor struck with pre-show nerves.

35.name: Infernal Rapier
35.description: The Infernal Rapier is a very rare rapier and a possible reward for following Wyll's companion quest. It raises your Spell Save DC and, unlike other rapiers, uses your Spellcasting Modifier for Attack Rolls and Damage Rolls  instead of Strength or Dexterity.
35.quote: Imagine the soul as a blade. A good one, carefully looked after. A bad one suited for rusting in the rain. Flame-chewed and narrow, this blade is Wyll's soul summarised in steel.

effects.name: High Spellcasting
effects.description: You gain a +1 bonus to Spell Save DC.

effects.name: Melee Caster
effects.description: Instead of its Dexterity Modifier, the affected entity adds its Spellcasting Ability Modifier to Attack Rolls.

effects.name: Planar Ally: Cambion|w=40
effects.description: Can cast once per Long Rest.

35.name: Pelorsun Blade
35.description: Pelorsun Blade is a very rare, lightly enchanted (+1) special variant of the Rapiers family of weapons that grants Advantage against Undead.
35.quote: After the blade had sliced Kas the Bloody-Handed's throat, it was chosen by Pelor, God of the Sun, to do righteous work against the undead.

effects.name: Undead Bane
effects.description: Attack Rolls with this weapon have Advantage against Undead.

35.name: Rapier
35.quote: A slender but deadly sword, favoured by Waterdhavian nobility.

35.name: Rapier +1
35.quote: A skillful smith decorated the wooden handle with a fine golden filigree.

35.name: Rapier +2
35.quote: The thin edge of this sword seems to blur and become nigh imperceptible with even the slightest movement.

35.name: Rupturing Blade
35.quote: The point of the rapier is capable of splitting into heated barbs should the wielder device to prick themselves to activate them - sacrifice for reward.

35.name: Sword of Screams
35.description: Sword of Screams is a un uncommon Rapier that deals an additional 1d4|Psychic damage.
35.quote: A blade of flawless craft. As it parts the air, you fancy you can hear a faint, whispering shriek...

36.name: Adamantine Scimitar
36.quote: Each cut of this blade shines with the wicked glint of adamantine -- a promise for a devastating blow.

effects.name: Diamondsbane
effects.description: If an adamantine weapon hits an object, the hit is always critical.

effects.name: Lethal Weapon
effects.description: This weapon ignores Resistance to Slashing damage.

36.name: Belm
36.quote: Faded but still legible, the mark of a Kara-Turan forgemaster adorns the pommel of this exquisite sword. Light as a robin's wing, quick as a gnomish wit, this weapon has unseamed many foes - and will continue to, in the correct hands.

36.name: Djinni Scimitar
36.description: Djinni Scimitar is the Scimitar used by a Djinni normally inaccessible to the player. It is a martial melee weapon wielded in one hand. As a finesse weapon, it can benefit from the wielder's Dexterity or Strength. It's a light weapon that anyone can dual-wield without special training.
36.quote: Contrary to popular belief, your standard djinni doesn't grant wishes, unless that wish is to have your nose lopped off.

36.name: Flame Blade (Weapon)
36.description: Flame Blade (Weapon) is a magical, conjured variant of the Scimitars family of weapons. It is a martial melee weapon wielded in one hand. As a finesse weapon, it can benefit from the wielder's Dexterity and not just their Strength.
36.quote: An ethereal scimitar made of living fire

36.name: Goblin Scimitar
36.description:
Goblin Scimitar is a common variant of the martial melee weapon wielded in one hand. As a finesse weapon, it can benefit from the wielder's Dexterity and not just their Strength. It's a light weapon that anyone can dual-wield without special training.

Beyond appearances, it has the same stats of a normal Scimitar.
36.quote: A cruel and crude blade forged en masse by goblin hordes.

36.name: Justiciar's Scimitar
36.description: Justiciar's Scimitar is a very rare Scimitarnotes weapon that can blind an opponent if the wielder strikes with Advantage.
36.quote: This light, curved blade is as unusual and unforgiving as the Darkness it strikes from.

effects.name: Shadow-Blinding
effects.description: If you attack with Advantage, you have a chance to Blind your target.

36.name: Kurwin's Cauteriser
36.quote: Mortician Kurwin was known to use his trusty Cauteriser on all sorts of interesting subjects. At first there were cadavers, then people who wouldn't be missed, and it was only after he targeted a well-liked tavern owner that he was ratted out to the law.

effects.name: Cauteriser
effects.description: Deals an additional 1d4|Fire damage.

effects.name: Anonymous Effect
effects.description: On a hit, the target starts Burning unless it succeeds a Constitution SavingThrow.

effects.name: Kurwin's Cauteriser
effects.description: On a hit, the target starts Burning unless it succeeds a Constitution SavingThrow.

36.name: Salty Scimitar(rrr)
36.description: Salty Scimitar(rrr) is a rare Scimitar that allows the wielder to cast Command.
36.quote: Shiver me timbers, this be a devilishly nasty blade.

effects.name: Anonymous Effect
effects.description: Cast Command as a Level 1 spell once per Long Rest

effects.name: Salty Scimitar(rrr)
effects.description: Cast Command as a Level 1 spell once per Long Rest

36.name: Scimitar
36.quote: This human-made scimitar falls far short of replicating the quality of the drow style it clearly imitates.

36.name: Scimitar +1
36.quote: The phases of the moon are carved into the hilt of this scimitar, betraying a druid's careful hand.

36.name: Scimitar +2
36.quote: An arched electric-blue afterimage follows this blade's every move.

effects.name: Scorching Strike|w=40
effects.description: Lash out with a blazing strike dealing an additional 1d0|Fire damage and possibly Burning (Condition)|Burn your target.

36.name: Speedy Reply
36.quote: A heavy haft and wide blade belie the speed of this weapon. It parts the air as swiftly as any dueling sabre.

effects.name: Nimble Attack
effects.description: When the wielder hits an enemy with this weapon, they gain Momentum for 2 turns.

36.name: Sylvan Scimitar
36.description: Sylvan Scimitar is an uncommon +1 Scimitar that allows its wielder to use their Spellcasting Ability modifier instead of their Attack Roll bonus.
36.quote: Everything moves strangely in the Feywild, from rivers to behaviours. It's a mercurial place, where the magical and physical can pass permeably through one another.

effects.name: Melee Caster
effects.description: Instead of its Dexterity modifier, the affected entity adds its Spellcasting Ability Modifier to Attack Rolls. Notes

36.name: Thorn Blade
36.description: Thorn Blade is a rare, lightly enchanted (+1) Scimitar that deals 1d4|Poison damage with melee weapons attacks while Concentrating and grants the ability to cast Ensnaring Strike (Melee).
36.quote: This Blade is sharp and slender as a serpent's fang - and just as likely to inflict a hideous sting.

effects.name: Poisonous Synergy
effects.description: While Concentrating, your melee weapon attacks deal an additional 1d4|Poison.

effects.name: Ensnaring Strike (Melee)|w=40
effects.description: Can cast once per Long Rest.

37.name: Blightbringer (Shortbow)
37.quote: Conducting a series of increasingly sick rituals - involving the ashes of a gnome and silkworms fed fat on the corpse of a dwarven cleric - the goblin shaman Kirruk Redrats created this deadly bow.

effects.name: Blightbringer
effects.description: Attacking Gnomes or Dwarves with this weapon receives a 1d4 bonus to Attack and Damage rolls.

effects.name: Prey Decelerator
effects.description: When this weapon lands a Critical Hit, it also Slowed|Slows the target creature.

37.name: Bow of Awareness
37.quote: This halfling bow requires a full draw for smaller folk, but serves as a quick off-hand for those of greater height.

effects.name: Seldom Caught Unawares
effects.description: You gain a +1 bonus to Initiative Rolls.

37.name: Bow of the Banshee
37.quote: The impression of an elven face screams silently from the finely curved bow - the image becomes even more disturbing when the bowstring snaps forward on release, emitting a blood-curdling wail.

effects.name: Blood-Curdling Emission
effects.description: On a hit, possibly inflict Frightened (WIS|dc=12 negates). Gain +1d4 bonus to attack and damage rolls against Frightened creatures.

37.name: Darkfire Shortbow
37.description: Darkfire Shortbow is a rare, moderately enchanted (+2) Shortbow that grants Resistance to Fire|Fire and Cold|Cold and grants the ability to cast Haste.
37.quote: This length of yew was polished in a lacquer made from the mingled, cooled, and refined breath of a gold and silver dragon.

effects.name: Haste|w=40
effects.description: Can cast once per Long Rest.

effects.name: Anonymous Effect
effects.description: Resistance to Fire damage.

effects.name: Anonymous Effect
effects.description: Resistance to Cold damage.

effects.name: Darkfire Shortbow
effects.description:
Resistance to Fire damage.
Resistance to Cold damage.

37.name: Goblin Bow
37.description: A Goblin Bow is the favored ranged weapon used and created by Goblins. Besides appearances, it functions exactly like a normal Shortbow.
37.quote: Fashioned together from a rough-cut branch and stinking sinew.

37.name: Hunting Shortbow
37.description: Hunting Shortbow is an uncommon, lightly enchanted (+1) Shortbow that grants Advantage against Monstrosity type enemies and the ability to cast Hunter's Mark.
37.quote: Supple and strong, this shortbow has been imbued with a ranger's solemn magic - running your fingers along the smooth ash, you can feel that solemnity like a ghost in the shaped wood.

effects.name: Feller of Monsters
effects.description: You have Advantage against Monstrosity type enemies.

effects.name: Hunter's Mark|w=40
effects.description: Can cast once per Long Rest.

37.name: Least Expected
37.quote:
One of the relics of Deep Duerra's rebellious children. It was to the tremendous surprise of all that Ludmilla, the quiet, the weepy, the daughter most under her mother's thumb, took up this bow and fired.
The arrow flashed, and while Duerra and her blinded court wailed importantly, the children escaped into an uncertain, yet sweetly free, future.

effects.name: Darkveil Precision
effects.description: While obscured in shadow, the wielder has an +1d4 bonus to their ranged weapon attacks.

37.name: Makeshift Bow
37.quote: Though Nothing more than a Flexible twig and string, this makeshift bow will do in a pinch.

37.name: Shortbow
37.quote: This small, agile bow bears a beautiful elven string, easy to draw but tough as steel.

37.name: Shortbow +1
37.quote: This halfling bow requires a full draw for smaller folk, but serves as a quick off-hand for those of greater height.

37.name: Vicious Shortbow
37.description:
Vicious Shortbow is a rare Shortbow that deals additional damage on a Critical Hit.
SpoilerWarning
37.quote: Pliable yew and a hearty bowstring ensure this shortbow fires straight and true.

effects.name: Dolor Amarus
effects.description: When you land a Critical Hit with this weapon, it deals an additional 7 damage.

38.name: Ambusher
38.quote: This blade is one of a few rare swords wielded by the Eucalyptus League, a group of fabulously wealthy courtesans who owned a great deal of Luskan's bazaars.

effects.name: Sentinel Weapon
effects.description: Gain a +1 bonus to Ability Checks.

effects.name: Ambusher's Streak
effects.description: In combat, you deal an additional 1d6|Necrotic damage against creatures that haven't taken a turn yet.

38.name: Assassin's Shortsword
38.description: Assassin's Shortsword is an uncommon Shortsword that grants the wielder Advantage on Stealth checks.
38.quote: Quiet is the air around this sword, and quiet are the steps of the one who wields it.

effects.name: Anonymous Effect
effects.description: Advantage on Stealth Checks.

effects.name: Assassin's Shortsword
effects.description: Advantage on Stealth Checks.

38.name: Chessa's Practice Sword
38.quote: A wooden sword coated in a thick layer of varnish. Well-loved, its handle is engraved with the name "Chessa".

38.name: Crimson Mischief
38.description: Crimson Mischief is a legendary hit points. When wielded in the off-hand, it instead allows the wielder to add their Ability Modifier to their damage.
38.quote: When she was a girl, she toyed with nastiness and sadism. Children often grow out of this; they get hobbies. For Orin, that taste for cruelty fermented, and in a way she did find hobbies. Ones that screamed.

effects.name: Prey Upon the Weak
effects.description: This weapon deals an additional 1d4|Piercing damage against targets with 50% of their hit points or fewer.

effects.name: Redvein Savagery
effects.description: When you make an attack with Advantage, the target takes an additional 7|Piercing|drs=t damage.

effects.name: Crimson Weapon
effects.description: When you make an attack with your off-hand weapon, you can add your Ability Modifier to the damage of the attack.

effects.name: Anonymous Effect
effects.description: Main Hand Only

effects.name: Crimson Mischief
effects.description: Main Hand Only

38.name: Executioner Sword
38.quote: Once there was a man who dreamed of unlocking every bit of his potential. It upset him when he couldn't; after all who can? When his daughter was born, she taught him about real dreams. She taught him with her eyes.

effects.name: Liberated Spellcasting
effects.description: When you kill a creature you can cast a Level 1 spell without expending a Spell Slot.

38.name: Fleshrender
38.description:
Fleshrender is a rare Shortsword that allows the wielder to make a diabolical strike, possibly stymying their target's ability to heal.
SpoilerWarning
38.quote: The previous owner was going to call this sword Barney, but he got such a bollocking from his friends that he named it Fleshrender instead, and sulked for a whole tenday afterward.

38.name: Githyanki Shortsword
38.quote: Despite its engravings, this lightweight sword is perfectly balanced - a flawless killing implement.

38.name: Kass' Practice Sword
38.quote: A wooden sword coated in a thick layer of varnish. Clumsy and covered in crude painted handprints like blood, the sword is engraved with the name 'Kass'.

38.name: Knife of the Undermountain King
38.description: The Knife of the Undermountain King is a very rare magical shortsword that increases the frequency of scoring Critical Hits and grants Advantage against enemies in the shadows.
38.quote: Snatched from the realm of the mad wizard Halaster Blackoak, this knife became a prized keepsake of a duergar king.

effects.name: Organ Rearranger
effects.description: Reduce the number you need to roll a Critical Hit while attacking by 1. This effect can stack. When you roll 2 damage or less, reroll the dice, taking the highest result.  (This effect applies to all attack and damage rolls while the weapon is equipped, whether they be physical or magical attacks, and not just rolls made using the weapon itself.)

effects.name: Shadow Blade
effects.description: You have Advantage on Attack Rolls against Lightly or Heavily Obscured targets when using this blade.

38.name: Practice Sword
38.description: The Practice Sword is a common Shortsword. It lacks the weapon actions of other shortswords, but is also the only shortsword that deals Bludgeoning damage.
