38.quote: Though carefully coated in a thick layer of varnish, the edges of the wooden sword are already starting to chip away.

38.name: Render of Mind and Body
38.quote: The best offence is a struck cognisance.

effects.name: Psychic Steel Virtuoso
effects.description: When the wielder attacks with Advantage, they deal an additional 1d8|Psychic|drs=t damage.

38.name: Rusty Shortsword
38.quote: Leopard spots of rust mottle this sword.

38.name: Shadow Blade (Weapon)
38.quote: Umbral claws sweep through the long slender facets of the blade

effects.name: Shadow Blade
effects.description: You have Advantage on Attack Rolls against Lightly or Heavily Obscured targets when using this blade.

effects.name: Anonymous Effect
effects.description: Performance +1

effects.name: Shadow Blade (Weapon)
effects.description: Performance +1

38.name: Shortsword
38.quote: A common and effective sword, carried by adventurers, thieves, and watchmen alike.

38.name: Shortsword (Yurgir)
38.quote: This dagger's handle is smooth and light, its jagged blade sharpened into a thin, cruel edge.

38.name: Shortsword +1
38.quote: A standard, lightweight sword, suitable for both thrusting and slashing techniques.

38.name: Shortsword +2
38.quote: A common and effective sword, carried by adventurers, thieves, and watchmen alike.

38.name: Shortsword of First Blood
38.description: The Shortsword of First Blood is an uncommon shortsword that deals more damage to enemies who haven't been injured yet.
38.quote: A golden blade, exquisitely made and astonishingly sharp.

effects.name: Break the Unbroken
effects.description: Deal an additional 1d8|Piercing damage to targets that still have all their hitpoints.

38.name: Slicing Shortsword
38.description: The Slicing Shortsword is a rare magical shortsword that inflicts Bleeding when the wielder attacks with Advantage.
38.quote: So sharp you can cut yourself just talking about it.

effects.name: Deepflesh Slice
effects.description: When the wielder attacks with Advantage, the attack inflicts Bleeding.

38.name: Steelforged Sword
38.quote: Though the grip's leather is old and crusty, it shows no signs of wear, and not a single scratch mars the slender blade.

38.name: Sword of Clutching Umbra
38.description: Sword of Clutching Umbra is a rare, lightly enchanted (+1) Shortsword that grants the wielder a unique weapon action, Shadowsoaked Blow.
38.quote: Fingers of Shadow seem to beckon from the dark edge of the blade.

38.name: Sword of Life Stealing
38.quote: Folded into the steel of this menacing weapon is an alloy of enchanted metal. It waits like a leech in thick swamp water, awaiting a victim to taste, awaiting a chance to restore your heartiness and inflict suffering on your foes.

effects.name: Life Stealing Critical
effects.description: On a Critical Hit, the target takes an extra 10|Necrotic|drs=t damage as long as it isn't a construct or an undead. You also gain 10 temporary hit points.

38.name: The Baneful
38.description: The The Baneful is a rare magical shortsword that only functions if it's Bound Weapon|Bound to an Eldritch Knight or is a Warlock's Pact Weapon.
38.quote: The wizard Otiluke wrote about bound weapons and their propensity to coalesce with their wielder as the pair come together. He also wrote about their dangers, which are manifold, and their benefits, which make the danger worth it.

effects.name: Favoured Weapon
effects.description: This weapon has a +1 bonus to  damage and Attack Rolls

effects.name: Baneful Bond
effects.description: On hit, possibly inflict Bane your target. DC 14.

38.name: Trepan
38.quote: Though blood and age have rusted the mechanism, a good twist can still make the blades on this bloodletting device spin.

39.name: Sickle
39.quote: A farming tool with a wicked edge, spilling blood and grain with equal ease.

39.name: Sickle (Redcap)
39.quote: A farming tool with a wicked edge, spilling blood and grain with equal ease.

39.name: Sickle of BOOOAL
39.quote: Infused with the inconceivable might of the formidable BOOOAL!

39.name: Sussur Sickle
39.description: The Sussur Sickle is a rare +1 Sickle that silences the targets it strikes, making it very effective against spellcasters.
39.quote: The sheen of sussur sap forged into this sickle glows blue, silencing every creature it cuts.

effects.name: Anonymous Effect
effects.description: Silenced|Silences targets on hit.

effects.name: Sussur Sickle
effects.description: Silenced|Silences targets on hit.

39.name: Wavemother's Sickle
39.quote: The curve of this sickle evokes a pitiless crescent moon over turbulent seas.

effects.name: Watery Guidance
effects.description: This weapon has Advantage against Wet creatures.

40.name: Sling
40.quote: Big, neat stitches line the supple leather pouch of this sling

41.name: Infernal spear
41.quote: Precise infernal runes are woven into this weapon's filigree, implying a creator well-versed in hellish arcana.

effects.name: Infernal Weapon
effects.description: On a hit, the affected entity deals an additional 3|Poison damage and can possibly Poisoned Condition Icon|Poisoned (Condition)|Poison its target.

41.name: Jagged Spear
41.description: Jagged Spear is an uncommon Spear that allows the wielder to possibly give their targets Disadvantage on Constitution Saving Throws.
41.quote: The blade of this spear is blackened and melted, leaving a cruel, rugged edge.

effects.name: Torturous Edges
effects.description: Tortured creatures may receive Disadvantage on Constitution Saving Throws.

effects.name: Anonymous Effect
effects.description: Triggered when hitting a target with this weapon

41.name: Lightning Jabber
41.quote: A makeshift spear fashioned from a giant crab's claw and the charged imagination of kuo-toa fishfolk.

effects.name: Shocking String
effects.description: On a hit, possibly Shock your target.

effects.name: Throwing: Lighting Damage
effects.description: When launched at a target, deal an additional 1d4|Lightning damage.

41.name: Pitchfork
41.description:
Pitchfork is a mundane, nonmagical variant of the simple melee weapon that is wielded must be wielded in both hands as it lacks the Versatile quality. It also can not be used a proper Thrown weapon as it also lacks that trait. Lastly, he doesn't even have any weapon actions to use as well.

Overall, it is a last resort weapon among even the most lowest quality of simple weapons.
41.quote: A farming tool crafted from mismatched branches, held together by fraying twine.

41.name: Rusty Spear
41.quote: While the handle is well made, the metal point is pitted with rust, and brittle as frozen underwear in the hands of a stone giant.

41.name: Selûne's Spear of Night
41.icon: Selûne's Spear of Night Unfaded Icon.png
41.description: Selûne's Spear of Night is a legendary Spear that allows the wielder to cast Moonbeam and grants Advantage on Wisdom Saving Throws and Perception Checks.
41.quote: 'One of the goddess Selûne's titles, Moonmaiden, has often been debated among the ecclesiastical. Common symbology certainly rejects the assumption of virginity. More to the point, 'maiden' itself carries some dusty connotations. How about Lunar Lady? Keeps the alliteration, too' - Margaery Henderplum

effects.name: Selûne's Blessing
effects.description: You gain Advantage on Wisdom SavingThrows and Perception Checks.

effects.name: Darkvision (Passive Feature)|Darkvision|w=40
effects.description: You can see in the dark up to 12m.

effects.name: Moonbeam|w=40
effects.description: Can cast once per Long Rest.

effects.name: Moonmote|w=40
effects.description: Can cast once once per Long Rest.

41.name: Shar's Spear of Evening
41.icon: Selûne's Spear of Night Unfaded Icon.png
41.description: Shar's Spear of Evening is a legendary Shar's Blessing and immunity to blindness.
41.quote: When visiting mortals in dreams, Shar's hair would curl and twist about her head like strands of inky midnight. If it tickled her nose, the goddess was careful not to show it.

effects.name: Shar's Blessing
effects.description: You gain Advantage on SavingThrows while Lightly or Heavily Obscured. This weapon deals an additional 1d6 damage to creatures that are Lightly or Heavily Obscured.

effects.name: Blind Immunity
effects.description: The wearer cannot be Blinded.

effects.name: Shar's Darkness|w=40
effects.description: Cast once Per Turn.

41.name: Spear
41.quote: An aged spear, its steel head nicked by the blows of a dozen battles.

41.name: Spear +1
41.quote: Forged by dwarven hands, and prized by all warriors who wish to keep their foe at a distance.

effects.name: Shar's Blessing
effects.description: If Shar allows it, use this spear to kill Nightsong.

41.name: The Watcher's Guide
41.quote: Time has dampened this spear's sheen, but the centre glows a faint blue. The magic it exudes feels old, terrible... and divine. The spear was given to its previous owner for his unerring loyalty - even after death.

effects.name: Death's Promise
effects.description: When the spear misses its target, the wielder's next Attack Roll against that target gains True Strike.

effects.name: Anonymous Effect
effects.description: True Strike Icon True Strike: The spellcaster has Advantage on Attack Rolls againts this creature.

effects.name: The Watcher's Guide
effects.description: True Strike Icon True Strike: The spellcaster has Advantage on Attack Rolls againts this creature.

41.name: Vision of the Absolute
41.icon: Vision of the Absolute Unfaded Icon.png
41.quote: The tip of this spear strikes unerringly toward its target's eyes.

effects.name: Absolute Night
effects.description: Blind targets that fails a Dexterity Saving Throw. Deals an additional 2d6|Piercing damage to certain creatures that sport multiple sets of eyes.

effects.description: DEX|dc=11 to negate Blind

42.name: Nyrulna
42.description: Nyrulna is a legendary, heavily enchanted (+3) special variant of the Tridents family of weapons that deals bonus Thunder|Thunder damage and can be thrown to create an explosion that also deals Thunder|Thunder damage.
42.quote: The forgemaster Lirrico designed this weapon for the champion of the wind goddess Akadi. A key component in the forging was his home city's wind, and for a year after the weapon was made, no wind blew there at all.

effects.name: Zephyr Connection
effects.description: This weapon will return to your hand when thrown. You cannot be forced to drop the trident. When thrown, the weapon creates an explosion that deals 3d4|Thunder damage in a 6m/20ft blast centered on the target.

effects.name: Veil of the Wind
effects.description: You gain a +3m/10ft bonus to movement speed and jump distance. Equipping this weapon gives you Immunity to falling damage.

effects.name: Nyrulna: Glowing
effects.description: This object shines with a glowing light in a radius of 6m/20ft.

42.name: The Sparky Points
42.description: The Sparky Points is a rare Trident that allows the wielder to generate Lightning Charges upon dealing damage with this weapon.
42.quote: When Yrre the Sparkstruck was asked why they'd created a trident twice their size, they simply replied, 'The question is - why not create another weapon with spikes like lightning bolts?'

effects.name: Electric Blood
effects.description: When the wielder deals damage using this weapon, they gain 2 Lightning Charges.

42.name: Trident
42.quote: It is said tridents were brought to the surface when Umberlee threw a Triton prince who scorned her onto Faerûn's shores.

42.name: Trident +1
42.quote: The brutal design of this weapon's trio of prongs forces pierced flesh apart.

effects.name: Hiemal Strike|w=40
effects.description: Pierce a creature with your frost-rimed trident dealing an additional 1d10|Cold damage and Chilled (Condition)|Chill it.

42.name: Trident of the Waves
42.quote: Umberlee, the goddess of the sea, is deeply capricious, intelligent, and not nearly as wet around the edges as her domain might suggest. She often demands sacrificial tribute from sailors, such as their ships, their cargo, and, while she's at it, them.

effects.name: The Water Caller
effects.description: On a hit, create a 2m water surface centered around the target.

43.name: Azer Warhammer
43.description: Hits with this weapon deal an additional 1d6|Fire damage.
43.quote: Flecks of volcanic glass gleam darkly from the head of this warhammer - obsidian eyes regarding the world with the narrow, spite-inflamed convictions of its azer wielder.

43.name: Ceremonial Warhammer
43.quote: Following tradition, this hammer's faces were forged with grooves that sealed in the blood of its first kill.

43.name: Charge-Bound Warhammer
43.description: Charge-Bound Warhammer is a rare, lightly enchanted (+1) Warhammer with +1 bonus to damage and Attack Rolls, and deals additional 1d6|Lightning damage.
43.quote: Energy crackles in weird and wonderful patterns across your hand as you wield this bound weapon, as if your very veins were marbled like a cloud of blue-white lightning.

effects.name: Favoured Weapon
effects.description: This weapon has a +1 bonus to damage and Attack Rolls.

effects.name: Shocking Bound
effects.description: This weapon deals an additional 1d6|Lightning damage.

effects.name: Anonymous Effect
effects.description: This hammer's magical powers only function if it's Bound to an Eldritch Knight or is a Warlock's Pact Weapon.

effects.name: Charge-Bound Warhammer
effects.description: This hammer's magical powers only function if it's Bound to an Eldritch Knight or is a Warlock's Pact Weapon.

43.name: Clown Hammer
43.quote: This hammer has a colourful history - it doesn't honk when you squeeze it, alas.

effects.name: Anonymous Effect
effects.description: Grim Irony: Whenever this weapon lands a critical hit, both target and attacker have to succeed a Wisdom Saving Throw, or be affected by fits of laughter.

effects.name: Clown Hammer
effects.description: Grim Irony: Whenever this weapon lands a critical hit, both target and attacker have to succeed a Wisdom Saving Throw, or be affected by fits of laughter.

43.name: Dwarven Thrower (Warhammer)
43.quote: The first Dwarven Thrower was created unintentionally. The moment was transcribed in the annals of dwarfdom thusly: 'Ach, it doesn't work. Another design down the bloody drain. Now to... Does er... Does anyone else hear a short of humming whistle? Growing louder?'

effects.name: Homing Weapon
effects.description: This weapon will return to its owner when Thrown.

effects.name: Dwarven Thrower
effects.description: A Dwarf throwing this warhammer deals an extra 1d8|Bludgeoning damage. If the target is Large, Huge or Gargantuan creature, the strike deals an additional 2d8|Bludgeoning damage.

43.name: Faithbreaker
43.quote: A hand-like brand stamped into the leather handle obscures the notches that would normally signify a hobgoblin's rank.

43.name: Hammer of the Just
43.description: Hammer of the Just is a rare Warhammer that deals additional Radiant damage, additional Bludgeoning damage to Fiends and Undead, and allows the wielder to cast Detect Thoughts.
43.quote: Tyr is often known as the Maimed God - a descriptor he shares with most victims of this heavy warhammer.

effects.name: Slay the Wicked
effects.description: This weapon deals an additional 1d6|Bludgeoning damage against Fiends and Undead.

effects.name: Detect Thoughts|w=40
effects.description: Can cast the spell once, per Long Rest.

43.name: Intransigent Warhammer
43.description: Intransigent Warhammer is an uncommon Warhammer that knock nearby foes Prone after killing a hostile target or landing a Critical Hit.
43.quote: The elegant design of this hammer belies its brutal, crushing power. This weapon does not give ground.

effects.name: Impulse Blast
effects.description: Knocks nearby creatures Prone after killing a target or landing a Critical Hit.

43.name: Ketheric's Warhammer
43.quote: This hammer's weight is centred on enchanted obsidian at the base of the head. Some nights before bed, Ketheric would sneak a whey-faced glance at the hammer, and think about the stone, and wonder what unknown facet of his heart bore his weight.

43.name: Orphic Hammer
43.description: The Orphic Hammer is a legendary, plot-critical Warhammer with the power to shatter infernal bonds.
43.quote: Every contract a devil makes has some form of insurance - this one is cast in infernal iron and was forged in deep, ruinous hellfire.

effects.name: Spell Resistance
effects.description: You have Advantage on SavingThrows against spells.

superRegion.name: Other Locations and Planes of Existence

43.name: Warhammer
43.quote: This hammer's noticeable lack of upkeep hardly matters, given its heft.

43.name: Warhammer +1
43.quote: Following tradition, this hammer's faces were forged with grooves that sealed in the blood of its first kill.

43.name: Warhammer +2
43.quote: The segmented design of this gnome-forged hammer borrows elements of dragonborn weaponry.

44.name: Deep Delver
44.quote: Countless hands have smoothened the haft and sharpened the blade. This is an ancestral weapon - perhaps dating back to the ancient digs that sundered the duergar from their dwarf-kin.

effects.name: Dig Deep
effects.description: Inflicts Shattered on hit.

effects.name: Anonymous Effect
effects.description: When attacking a Shattered target, deal an additional 1d4|Piercing damage.

effects.name: Deep Delver
effects.description: When attacking a Shattered target, deal an additional 1d4|Piercing damage.

44.name: Hoppy
44.description: Hoppy is an uncommon War Pick that allows the wielder to use Revitalising Strike.
44.quote: Not the most elegant of weapons, the warpick's cumbersome weight certainly allows it to be deadly in combat, when wielded by a strong arm. Inexplicably, this one has a small rabbit carved into the handle.

44.name: Pickaxe
44.description: War Pick is a mundane, nonmagical variant of the martial melee weapon wielded in two-handed, making it unique among other War Picks.
44.quote: A plain tool, covered almost entirely in coppery rust.

44.name: War Pick
44.quote: A pickaxe modified to pierce flesh and armour rather than stone.

44.name: War Pick +1
44.quote: When swung, the arc of this weapon perfectly matches the curve of its beak-like pick.
